commit_message:
Bring vexxhost back online for testing

We created a new mirror in vexxhost with no bandwidth limits, the
thought here is this should results in better job run times as our
mirror will not be the bottleneck.

We've also changed flavors to use v2-highcpu-8 which are 8C/8Gb
memory, but require us to now boot-from-volume with 80GB volume-size.

Change-Id: Ibb26597cfd3c3b10891d7a60e70c6143d1c12407
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Temporarily make legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src NV

Stable/pike is currently broken due to a change in pip [0] and
a change in setuptools [1]. Each change is needed to land to fix
things, but they are in different repos, so there is no way to
combine the changes into one to get it through.

This patch makes the failing job for one non-voting to get that
in, to allow getting in the other one, at which point this one
will be reverted.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554270/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554053/

Change-Id: I9c46fb9af99bc1960cee513e0cf383f751b0126b

commit_message:
Create new project for oslo.limit

During the Rocky PTG, it was decided that services should have some
sort of library to help with quota enforcement based on limits stored
in keystone. This relationship is very similar to how services
enforce policy decisions based on role assignments in keystone using
the oslo.policy library.

This commit creates a new oslo library called oslo.limit to fill this
need.

Needed-By: I46d5d16f29a4a613c96f01023c89e94b39abf2dd
Change-Id: I1bdb05189fa0346426cb36d4a3d5fe458eb69871

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-27 11:52:07.000000000', 'message': 'Update placement aggregates spec to clarify generation handling

This adds a paragraph to the placement-aggregate-generation spec to
clarify that in older microversions, the generation of the resource
provider will be updated without conflict detection. Previously
the generation was not updated at all.

We need this to ensure that the value being gained from the proposed
change is present in the face of older clients of the placement
service when there are also new clients.

This change is safe with regard to microversions because:

* no request or response bodies are being changed
* clients have always been required to be resilient in the face
  of resource provider generation changes

blueprint placement-aggregate-generation

Change-Id: I41e06d4bddf2ad5d12de99d19118ded96159cdd2
Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Update placement aggregates spec to clarify generation handling

This adds a paragraph to the placement-aggregate-generation spec to
clarify that in older microversions, the generation of the resource
provider will not be updated. We considered updating it whatever the
microversion but it turns out that there's extant code relying on
the old behavior.

blueprint placement-aggregate-generation

Change-Id: I41e06d4bddf2ad5d12de99d19118ded96159cdd2
Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 08:02:34.000000000', 'message': 'abstracted away the cloud driver interface

Change-Id: Ic4df2fc2986e7077afb1f937754f0f20b4f8ed3a
'}, {'created': '2017-11-28 08:48:43.000000000', 'message': 'Abstract away the cloud driver interface

This change decouples cloud drivers (presently just libvirt)
from the Redfish REST API server. The purpose is to be able to
support multiple clouds in parallel by way of dedicated and
unified drivers. Most immediate candidate would be novaclient
(e.g. OpenStack API).

The change has two parts to it:

* introduced an abstract base class for cloud driver
* introduced the libvirt driver based on the existing libvirt
  code refactored into to the abstract driver framework

There should be no change in functionality of the libvirt driver.

Change-Id: Ic4df2fc2986e7077afb1f937754f0f20b4f8ed3a
'}, {'created': '2017-12-05 19:49:34.000000000', 'message': 'Abstract away the virtualization management interface

This change decouples the virtualization drivers (presently just
libvirt) from the Redfish REST API server. The purpose is to
be able to support multiple virtualization backends in parallel by
way of running dedicated and unified drivers. Most immediate
candidate would be novaclient (e.g. OpenStack API).

The change has two parts to it:

* introduced an abstract base class for the virtualization driver
* introduced the libvirt driver based on the existing libvirt
  code refactored into to the abstract driver framework

There should be no change in functionality of the libvirt driver.

commit_message:
Abstract away the virtualization management interface

This change decouples the virtualization drivers (presently
just libvirt) from the Redfish REST API server. The
goal is to be able to support multiple virtualization
backends in parallel by way of running dedicated and
unified drivers. Most immediate candidate would be
novaclient (e.g. OpenStack API).

The change has two parts to it:

* introduced an abstract base class for the virtualization
  driver
* introduced the libvirt driver based on the existing
  libvirt code refactored into to the abstract driver
  framework
* implemented Redfish-compliant error reporting

There should be no change in functionality of the libvirt
driver.

Change-Id: Ic4df2fc2986e7077afb1f937754f0f20b4f8ed3a

[{'created': '2017-12-01 22:08:30.000000000', 'message': 'Make GroupsV3TestJSON v2 compatible

This patch aims to replace the domain created for testing by the
domain used when getting v3 credentials. This is the name keystone
uses for v2 compatibility.

During group or user creation, the lookup of the domain will cause
a 404 to be returned because v3 created domains are not visible to
the v2 domain.

By using the default_credentials_domain_name option, it allows users
of domain_specific_drivers config option to specify the domain name
that was used for their pre-provisioned credentials.

Change-Id: I136b28f90280857ae8e9b0e968e67445e2cce44d
'}]
commit_message:
Make GroupsV3TestJSON v2 compatible

This patch aims to replace the domain created for testing by the
domain used when getting v3 credentials. This is the name keystone
uses for v2 compatibility.

During group or user creation, the lookup of the domain will cause
a 404 to be returned because v3 created domains are not visible to
the v2 domain.

By using the default_credentials_domain_name option, it allows users
of domain_specific_drivers config option to specify the domain name
that was used for their pre-provisioned credentials.

Change-Id: I136b28f90280857ae8e9b0e968e67445e2cce44d

commit_message:
Make V3CredsClient:create_user domain-aware

This will allow tempest to configure users to another domain other
than the Default domain.

Change-Id: I22241be6bc34851da76c67b0b8cdc4c62563d24b
Closes-Bug: #1721231

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 03:45:50.000000000', 'message': 'Do not collect physical host facts in playbook

The role itself depends on physical host facts being collected,
but the collection occurring in the playbook does not accommodate
--limit containername, it will require
--limit containername:physicalhost in order for the required facts
to be collected.

To allow limit to target only the containers being created, the
fact collection has been moved to the role and the module is
executed against the physical_host using delegation.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554105/
Change-Id: Idc0ae7913b3ea9374caa41a207fab8c72f42bf41
'}]
commit_message:
Do not collect physical host facts in playbook

The role itself depends on physical host facts being collected,
but the collection occurring in the playbook does not accommodate
--limit containername, it will require
--limit containername:physicalhost in order for the required facts
to be collected.

To allow limit to target only the containers being created, the
fact collection has been moved to the role and the module is
executed against the physical_host using delegation.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554105/
Change-Id: Idc0ae7913b3ea9374caa41a207fab8c72f42bf41

commit_message:
Change base-test to use "ara-report" role instead of "emit-ara-html"

Merging this will allow us to test the new ara-report role with various
configurations before merging it to the base job.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/513874
Change-Id: Ibfdb2ac8c0d357e95acdf6f22abe2acc2c95b39c

commit_message:
Correct is_container when deploying containers

The is_container option was not be set or correctly interpreted. This
change sets the option when the openstack_host role is run on
containers.

Example host specific tasks running on containers unnecessarily:
  http://logs.openstack.org/36/553636/2/check/openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_lxc-ubuntu-xenial/3805c3f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-16_02_31_02_897102

Change-Id: Ic90ae64dc00802154bf51831f4ed459d945600b9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0595e23ff7fa612666fa971312dfcfe719e002ce)

commit_message:
Import systemd_mount and systemd_service to OSA

This patch adds the generic roles systemd_mount,
systemd_networkd, and systemd_service,
manipulating systemd units.

This is for DRY purposes.

An individual core group is added, but the general OSA
core group would have core capabilities as a back-stop
for now, until more diversity is found.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552866/
Change-Id: Ic139198d4ef3fdd9c6d1ba3555e6e94a20b613bc

commit_message:
Optimize tasks for the container backend if defined

When the machinectl backend is in service there's no need to create a
tarball of the container rootfs. This change sets a fact for the backend
store and skips tasks that are unnecessary when using machinectl.

Change-Id: Ie759ae486157a31523b261041eb66bbb20f80e5a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove puppet-apps_site

puppet-apps_site is a retired project and is no longer in the main zuul
config. We have to remove it from the require-project's list from jobs
that included it for this reason.

Change-Id: I7cd24488fd6602672556e19336e146e167298d65

commit_message:
Gate: stop setting IRONIC_ENABLED_INSPECT_INTEFACES=inspector

First, this is already handled by the ironic-inspector devstack plugin.
Second, this list does not include the fake implementation, and since
we enabled fake-hardware, the conductor no longer starts.

Change-Id: I705ec9d03d33623bd908e1a48f428062041b5d89

[{'created': '2018-03-16 11:39:23.000000000', 'message': 'Utilise OrderedDict to ensure no random changes

As part of the ceph-ansible project, this change was put in:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/ec042219e64a321fa67fce0384af76eeb238c645
This was to handle the case where the config would change, initiating a
restart handler, even though no actual change happened.

Additionally, this adds a test to retemplate the file 10 times, with a
lot more sections to ensure the order remains the same, this will fail
when the config template changes even though no changes have happened.

Change-Id: I7c7cd9ef1dd767a2a5d754ac4663cf8655dd60c2
'}, {'created': '2018-03-16 15:22:54.000000000', 'message': "Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes

As part of the ceph-ansible project, this change was put in:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/ec042219e64a321fa67fce0384af76eeb238c645
This was to handle the case where the config would change, initiating a
restart handler, even though no actual change happened.

We can juse use sorted() since we are passing back a list with .items()
which can then be sorted.

The above change didn't include a change to ensure the order of the
sections, which meant that although the individual items were sorted the
sections could change order causing unnecessary changes.

Additionally, this adds a test to retemplate the file 10 times, with a
lot more sections to ensure the order remains the same, this will fail
when the config template changes even though no changes have happened.

Change-Id: I7c7cd9ef1dd767a2a5d754ac4663cf8655dd60c2

commit_message:
Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes

As part of the ceph-ansible project, this change was put in:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/ec042219e64a321fa67fce0384af76eeb238c645
This was to handle the case where the config would change, initiating a
restart handler, even though no actual change happened.

We can juse use sorted() since we are passing back a list with .items()
which can then be sorted.

The above change didn't include a change to ensure the order of the
sections, which meant that although the individual items were sorted the
sections could change order causing unnecessary changes.

Additionally, this adds a test to retemplate the file 3 times, with a
lot more sections to ensure the order remains the same, this will fail
when the config template changes even though no changes have happened.

Change-Id: I7c7cd9ef1dd767a2a5d754ac4663cf8655dd60c2

commit_message:
Update supervisor version lower bound

Supervisor has XML-RPC security vulenalbility. Upgrade to 3.3.3.
Refer to https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-11610.

Story: 2001648
Task: 6667

Change-Id: I1f0e2c3436a0bbeeaf8beebcf15b066de5df7c90

commit_message:
Deprecate use of mon_use_fqdn from tls_everywhere docs

This was useful to workaround a bug in ceph-ansible fixed by [1].

Those deployments previously enabling use of fqdn to set the
mon instance names will continue to work as long as the boolean
is passed on upgrades.

1. https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/bdcc52b96dc1f9c99ce490117170f644623d4846

Change-Id: Ibf2bc50aa2ac63935ebe806d9ff3b26f64969ec6
Closes-Bug: 1752913

[{'created': '2018-03-14 10:01:33.000000000', 'message': 'Update contributor/placement.rst to contemporary reality

This udpates the placement contributor documentation to reflect the
current state of affairs. Ininitially this was just going to be an
update to reflect that the oslo versioned objects had moved. However,
while reviewing the rest of the doc it became clear there were other
issues that should be resolved. Doing so in one shot helps to maintain
the continuity of the document and doing it piecemeal means it is less
likely to happen.

Change-Id: Ia8d4861799e27a30108dd465d15828c5a1943819
'}]
commit_message:
Update contributor/placement.rst to contemporary reality

This udpates the placement contributor documentation to reflect the
current state of affairs. Ininitially this was just going to be an
update to reflect that the oslo versioned objects had moved. However,
while reviewing the rest of the doc it became clear there were other
issues that should be resolved. Doing so in one shot helps to maintain
the continuity of the document and doing it piecemeal means it is less
likely to happen.

Change-Id: Ia8d4861799e27a30108dd465d15828c5a1943819

commit_message:
Conflict adding cinder type (lvmdriver-1)

In a multinode environment, c-vol should be enabled on the second node
which triggers volume type creation (as per documentation). When running
stack.sh on the second node,an error is reported cinder is trying to
create a volume type that already exists.

In this fix, check to see if the volume type exists before creating it.

Closes-Bug: #1390028

Change-Id: Id7ae00456f1be5c1aed9461379a99832f8faf5ed
Signed-off-by: Amy Fong <amy.fong@windriver.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-16 12:20:14.000000000', 'message': 'add libnss3-dev

The devstack script failed to install openstack when I used ocata devstack on ubuntu 16.04. The reason I found in the stack.sh.log was that it failed to install python-nss.

Should we add libnss3-dev in the files/debs/general?

Change-Id: I5af45b7d3034215d1accda1e061f11024f51347f
'}]
commit_message:
add libnss3-dev

The devstack script failed to install openstack when I used ocata devstack on ubuntu 16.04. The reason I found in the stack.sh.log was that it failed to install python-nss.

Should we add libnss3-dev in the files/debs/general?

Change-Id: I5af45b7d3034215d1accda1e061f11024f51347f

commit_message:
Safety for SERVICE_DIR and SUBUNIT_DIR

Make sure the $SERVICE_DIR directory and directory of $SUBUNIT_OUTPUT
exist with proper ownership.

Fixes issue #1551080

Change-Id: If6a669e144862c979f8ade70d73d140cdf79b0c2

commit_message:
Use absolute path for etcd download

Do not assume that Devstack is always in its directory as devstack
plugins may change that, resulting in a broken gate.

Change-Id: I6b5b6c070e3a73210c63a0382e35a9965d007bb4

commit_message:
Add fixed_key in cinder.conf

When Cinder creates an encrypted volume from image, it accesses
the key manager to get the key, encryptes the image data, and writes to
volume. This feature is introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216567/.

By default, it uses ConfKeyManager. The key manager needs
the parameter fixed_key set in config file. This key manager is just
for test, not for customer usage.

Change-Id: I1265cc2af2acb1d950c7a944e607a9707d2f69e6

commit_message:
allow specify identity api version via openrc

This patch adds some optional arguments to allow users specify
OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION via openrc script, to let them have a better
life :)

PS: There is no need to append version path in OS_AUTH_URL because we
already set environment variable OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION.

Change-Id: Id2e01daaa182861693d481a34bdb9248f5ca8ead

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-02 11:16:02.000000000', 'message': '[demo] admin only endpoint

This run is for demonstrating what would happen if we would
use the keystone admin entry point for both endpoints.

As you (probably) can see, a little extra tweak will be required
to simplify the keystone deployments.

Change-Id: I126d70b4fc6c091fa82cc80a27a54ff4cd687c5c
'}]
commit_message:
[demo] admin only endpoint

This run is for demonstrating what would happen if we would
use the keystone admin entry point for both endpoints.

As you (probably) can see, a little extra tweak will be required
to simplify the keystone deployments.

Change-Id: I126d70b4fc6c091fa82cc80a27a54ff4cd687c5c

On Ubuntu xenial, run_tests.sh fails because 'cowsay' used for tests of
package operation functions has now dependency.
It's better to replace 'cowsay' by some reasonablly small and stable
package such as 'dvorak7min' rather than changing test logic.

Change-Id: I791b2a67eb84f864b909befd455156a3f4f4294b
Closes-Bug: 1614185
Signed-off-by: Masanori Itoh <masanori.itoh@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Replace 'cowsay' by 'dvorak7min' in tests/test_functions.sh

On Ubuntu xenial, run_tests.sh fails because 'cowsay' used for tests of
package operation functions has now dependency.
It's better to replace 'cowsay' by some reasonablly small and stable
package such as 'dvorak7min' rather than changing test logic.

Change-Id: I791b2a67eb84f864b909befd455156a3f4f4294b
Closes-Bug: 1614185
Signed-off-by: Masanori Itoh <masanori.itoh@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-03-09 14:10:51.000000000', 'message': 'Make unstack.sh keep Keystone Apache config

rejoin-stack.sh will not recreate symlink
/etc/apache2/sites-enabled/keystone.conf. A better way is not to remove
symlink in unstack.sh.

Change-Id: Ied4a3a600d7df36afe2cf6ebaca4c250a731ab15
Closes-Bug: #1551452
'}]
commit_message:
Make unstack.sh keep Keystone Apache config

rejoin-stack.sh will not recreate symlink
/etc/apache2/sites-enabled/keystone.conf. A better way is not to remove
symlink in unstack.sh.

Change-Id: Ied4a3a600d7df36afe2cf6ebaca4c250a731ab15
Closes-Bug: #1551452

commit_message:
DVR-FWaaS: Fix DVR FWaaS rules for fipnamespace

FWaaS for DVR routers were only supported for
North-South traffic. But with the recent change
in the DVR router-info to handle FloatingIP's
as mentioned in the reference patch[1], the
dist_fip_count variable was removed and was
replaced by rtr_fip_connect.

So change in variable 'rtr_fip_connect' was
not fixed in FWaaS.

This patch fixes it in the FWaaS to apply
the Firewall rule in the router namespace
for the North-South traffic.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/283757

Closes-Bug: #1715395
Change-Id: Id8c902381f95e39bc13e3b3aeeeaa799c72f0dca

xenserver: recheck'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-02-27 14:19:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

This is going to break test jobs that rely on projects that have not yet set themselves up to run under python 3. For now I know that includes any job using swift, but I'm sure there are other cases.

For this cycle, while we're still working the goal, we need to allow mixed-mode installations. At the end of the cycle, we can evaluate where we stand and discuss options like dropping mixed-mode installations, shifting completely to python 3, and treating python 2-only projects as third-party tools that are installed separately. That discussion needs to be based on the progress we make during Pike, though."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-02-27 14:36:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > This is going to break test jobs that rely on projects that have
 > not yet set themselves up to run under python 3. For now I know
 > that includes any job using swift, but I'm sure there are other
 > cases.

More specifically, Heat has some tests that rely on Swift. If we require all services to support Python 3 in order to be used in a test job running under Python 3, Heat would need to disable Swift and skip those tests (for now). That means portions of Heat won't be tested under Python 3, even though they can be when Swift is deployed under 2. That's how Heat was running its tests, until https://review.openstack.org/#/c/436495/ landed to allow better test coverage."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-02-28 16:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-03-19 17:07:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The patch has been in merge conflict for a long time, feel free to restore the patch and continue working on it'}]

commit_message:
WIP: simplify the python3 logic

We've got the compute starter kit + cinder running under python3. The
path forward at this point isn't really mixed mode, it's -nv python3
jobs until they get voting by projects, then flip those on.

Change-Id: If2fd7a65a317f1cc9ab8a9ebb0c0d7e94142cfff

commit_message:
tempest: set encrypted_vol_from_image flag

Cinder fixes the problem to create encrypted volume
from images in Newton. The corresponding tempest test
is going to add.

Depends-On: Ia51fc89cc743121fbe686406eb3a1685518476bd
Change-Id: I0ccde67abe91d2740f0316eabdb26e4784e4f983

subject: Ability to force pre-cache of test images

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-31 03:42:17.000000000', 'message': "Ability to force pre-cache of test images

Add DEVSTACK_NO_DOWNLOAD_IMAGE to prevent automatic downloads of test
images.  This is for situations where images should be pre-cached and
we wish to ensure we are not hitting the network to download during
test runs.

Note when in use with devstack-gate, this is a bit of a chicken-egg
problem for adding new downloads (gate would have to cache them before
they are usable).  Initial testing can easily override this
explicitly.  At commit time, we would need to commit the image update
first, allow a new build of the infra-images and then commit whatever
is using the image (or, just accept the new test is broken until the
new daily image builds with the download in it).  Given the
infrequency at which this occurs and worst-case latency of 24 hours
(next image build), I don't see this being a big issue.

Change-Id: Iace57fd0042c35535e72a3b316ea594516968113

commit_message:
Ability to force pre-cache of test images

Add DEVSTACK_NO_DOWNLOAD_IMAGE and equivalent sentinel file to prevent
automatic downloads of test images.  This is for situations where
images should be pre-cached and we wish to ensure we are not hitting
the network to download during test runs (see
Iace57fd0042c35535e72a3b316ea594516968113)

For OpenStack CI, I23cdeb6757e2a633b634b6db7353acb8122e4745 adds the
sentinel file to cache in the daily image builds.

Note when in use with CI, this is a bit of a chicken-egg problem for
adding new downloads (gate would have to cache them before they are
usable).  Initial testing can easily override this explicitly.  At
commit time, we would need to commit the image update first, allow a
new build of the infra-images and then commit whatever is using the
image (or, just accept the new test is broken until the new daily
image builds with the download in it).  Given the infrequency at which
this occurs and worst-case latency of 24 hours (next image build), I
don't see this being a big issue (also, this is what we've tried to do
manually before when adding images to avoid hitting the network in
runs.  This just enforces it).

Change-Id: Iace57fd0042c35535e72a3b316ea594516968113

subject: Delete function of "isset"

isset() should never have been a ting, it's a single test and doesn't add much value.

A number of isset() invocations were missed however:

* In function-common export_proxy_variables() I do thing that exporting the variable if it is set (even if a zero-length value) is the Right Thing.  isset can be replaced by [[ ! -v "$1" ]].

* In stackrc, the isset call around ENABLED_SERVICES should be is_set().'}, {'account_id': 14257, 'date': '2015-07-13 07:14:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Dean, thank you for your comment.
I noticed my mistake.
I forgot to change isset() -> is_set() in functions-common export_proxy_variables().
I wasn't aware that  isset() is called in stackrc.
I'll fix these miss."}, {'account_id': 14257, 'date': '2015-07-13 07:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-07-13 08:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

i feel like the test-cases really duplicate the "die_if_not_set" testing done at the top of the file.  i guess it doesn't hurt but please at least move them together'}, {'account_id': 14257, 'date': '2015-07-16 06:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Dean, Ian, thank you for your comment.

> Try the tests on the old isset() function and compare the difference.

I'm sorry that it is complexed.
In this patch, I removed isset() and added testing is_set() because there isn't testing is_set(). I reused testing isset() because is_set() included isset() algorithm (is_set() is "isset + [ -n ${!1} ]"(Is variable set and not empty ?)).
I added "Is variable not empty?" test.

> i feel like the test-cases really duplicate the "die_if_not_set" testing done at the top of the file. i guess it doesn't hurt but please at least move them together

I want to hear your ideas.

Testing is_set()(old isset()) looks like to duplicate testing die_if_not_set(), however these  test intention are different. I don't seem to remove ether function's test.
I think each function needs UnitTests because it is not only die_if_not_set() to use is_set(). is_set can be used from other functions.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-10-29 00:48:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 20992, 'date': '2016-03-21 19:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 05:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-03-19 17:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The patch has been in merge conflict for a long time, feel free to restore the patch and continue working on it'}]

commit_message:
Delete function of "isset"

The function of "is_set" & "isset" is duplicated.
This patch deletes function of "isset" and replaces "isset" with "is_set"
where "isset" is called.

Change-Id: Idcb0605330ba4680e40578603459f82c0e8377ba

Perhaps a fix here is just to parameterize that as well?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2016-09-29 11:18:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I see that you have three images here - and the same list of images in the project-config change. The names should be in one place only.'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2016-09-29 11:29:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Is the confusion around the hardcoded number '3'?  This isn't the number of elements in the list of virt drivers, but rather the total number of images identified to download.  Each driver could require an arbitrary number of images and request they be cached, but the impact of reducing the list of drivers in the project-config change is that the original hardcoded check of 5 images is more than will be cached by default for Infra's runs"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2016-09-30 19:14:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Andreas, I agree the list of drivers should not be in multiple places, and I'll suggest that this script is the wrong place for it.  We should be polite about removing it, but putting the list required by CI in project-config makes much more sense to me..."}, {'account_id': 17169, 'date': '2016-10-21 03:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-21 04:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

overall this seems like a good idea to get rid of some of the larger unneeded images.

however, I don't really agree with the deprecation part.  firstly nobody reads lines like that mixed in thousands of other lines of output [1], but secondly we should default to "just work" as much as possible.

So I'd support making the default able to be overridden for people who know what they in cases like infra, with added documentation about how to use this so people can actually discover how to trim the list (I guess it fits in configuration.rst) 

[1] we actually have a "deprecated" function to call this stuff out at least into the warnings summary file, but not convinced we actually have a clear way to deprecate this anyway.'}, {'account_id': 17169, 'date': '2016-10-24 06:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 17169, 'date': '2016-10-24 06:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

 image_list.sh --exclude xenserver vmware # everything BUT these.  for infra, where we know we don't need some things, but want to default to downloading until we cull it manually

I made minor changes to the configuration.rst for wording and updated the changelog to reflect what's happening in the latest change.

There's been a couple of things coming up that are around plugins for nova drivers which to my mind aren't fully defined. "}, {'created': '2016-10-31 02:59:44.000000000', 'message': 'tools/image_list.sh : allow reduced drivers

Add the ability to prue the driver list to avoid downloading
unnecessary images in CI pre-cache situations.

commit_message:
tools/image_list.sh : allow reduced drivers

Add the ability to prue the driver list to avoid downloading
unnecessary images in CI pre-cache situations.

I7db026ad20f30b457522fbffd8e0a90787d69a99 uses this to reduce
unnecessary images in the openstack CI builds

Change-Id: I73455940b50c1123fd0dc2bba592c5bbf977d52a

commit_message:
Differentiate between DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME and filename

The DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME variable is used to reference the name of the
default image in glance after it has been uploaded by devstack. It is
used both inside and outside of devstack for that purpose. However, when
configuring tempest there are some tests which also do image uploads and
need a filename for specifying which file they should upload into glance
for testing purposes. Previously we were just using DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME
for both purposes, but this causes a conflict if the name of the image
we upload into glance does not have a file extension. So instead of
conflating the things this commit differentiates between them and adds a
new DEFAULT_IMAGE_FILE_NAME variable to use for this purpose.

This conflicts because there were several intermediate changes before
this was finished. This just skips to the end state. Additionally the
change id is removed because to get things working in the gate
consistently this needs to land in a very specific order. This can't be
done if the change-ids all match.

 Conflicts:
	lib/tempest
	stackrc

(cherry picked from commit befe0925e7cb3d3b34ee9e856c4bc822a499975f)

Depends-On: Iee7c922cd534ff9ec67cffd2aaa1a03360c1b74a
Change-Id: Ic276cbbb91aaf73ba44e588a607338b93d056da8

commit_message:
Add support for pip and git repo names not matching

python-openstacksdk publishes to PyPI as openstacksdk. The previous
patch added a hard-coded work around. This is a stab at a more general
approach to the problem.

Change-Id: I23b9b6fc56bc76e4cb20d98b1a45758d41631c68

commit_message:
Add api_version wraps for group snapshot list in v3/shell.py

The API 'do_group_snapshot_list' in v3/shell.py misses api_version wraps,
and the cmd 'cinder group-snapshot-list' can be used even not specifing
the param 'os-volume-api-version'. This patch just to fix it.

Change-Id: I6a46e587b1aab692fe6b81b46fa3d95ab66c0625

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Keystone service stop after restarting systemd-journald.

To avoid this issue, keystone service service should 'restart' not 'start'.
q-svc and placement-api as well.

Closes-Bug: #1697113
Closes-Bug: #1697124
Change-Id: I5c22902be765dd8cbe1a8e8e1a6e4f569498f723

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 12:06:29.000000000', 'message': "Fail 'node introspect --all-manageable' if no nodes were introspected

Users calling this command tend to assume they have nodes to be
introspected. Currently if no nodes actually are introspected, e.g.
due to maintenance mode or incorrect state, we report success.
This change makes it report failure.

Also changes the success log to include the number of nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1756855
Change-Id: I22e0a525ec8bce265abbbd69ee383e678043649a
"}]
commit_message:
Fail 'node introspect --all-manageable' if no nodes were introspected

Users calling this command tend to assume they have nodes to be
introspected. Currently if no nodes actually are introspected, e.g.
due to maintenance mode or incorrect state, we report success.
This change makes it report failure.

Also changes the success log to include the number of nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1756855
Change-Id: I22e0a525ec8bce265abbbd69ee383e678043649a

commit_message:
Use config opt value to determine import methods

Instead of validating import requests by checking the provided
import-method against a hard-coded list, use the values in the
appropriate configuration option.

Change-Id: Iefac190a4adf5f08df538e04db3e07e261ad1bd9
Closes-bug: #1754634

[{'created': '2018-03-16 11:37:10.000000000', 'message': "Check for `standard-attr-tag` Neutron extension

`tag` and `tag-ext` Neutron extensions are deprecated and scheduled for
removal in Rocky. Those are replaced by `standard-attr-tag` extensions
and this commit implements it's support in kuryr-libnetwork.

Change-Id: I295a5b84eb7fa3439561fa009b7499f94d8df4d2
Closes-Bug: 1756305
"}, {'created': '2018-03-16 11:53:26.000000000', 'message': 'Check for `standard-attr-tag` Neutron extension

`tag` and `tag-ext` Neutron extensions are deprecated and scheduled for

commit_message:
Check for `standard-attr-tag` Neutron extension

`tag` and `tag-ext` Neutron extensions are deprecated and scheduled for
removal in Rocky. Those are replaced by `standard-attr-tag` extensions
and this commit implements its support in kuryr-libnetwork.

Change-Id: I295a5b84eb7fa3439561fa009b7499f94d8df4d2
Closes-Bug: 1756305

commit_message:
Add a test class to validate UTs fixes of new_facade flag

In I3a8bc06a671e37959e3014f8672b9a5e118c5c52, we added mocks to
avoid touching databases when switching to new engine facade.
However, currently we do not have test codes to catch those failure.
This patch adds a fake object setting new_facade to True, to validate
without I3a8bc06a671e37959e3014f8672b9a5e118c5c52, the test class
would fail.

Change-Id: I968806b237f9c1275e7624a0995189c1d0bc75fb
Closes-Bug: #1750735

subject: DNM: Test to show a particular behavior in tests

[{'created': '2018-03-19 13:39:46.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Test to show a particular behavior in tests

Test with: `tox -epy27 test_delete_completed_rows_retries_exceptions`

Two starter questions,

1) First thing is that new enginefacade seems to try to open a new

doing to avoid this issue?

2) Is the retry decorator needed with enginefacade?

commit_message:
DNM: Test to show a particular behavior in tests

Test with: `tox -epy27 test_delete_completed_rows_retries_exceptions`

Two starter questions,

1) First thing is that new enginefacade seems to try to open a new
connection to with each session. This hits the limitation that sqlite
databases cannot be connected twice. Is there something else I should be
doing to avoid this issue?

2) Is the retry decorator needed with enginefacade?

Change-Id: Id561c212f66dc123c8c3ca9685f1f0a654bb310a

commit_message:
Fix BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

BOOTSTRAP_OPTS was surrounded by " ", which meant it would evaluate to:
-e 'BOOTSTRAP_OPTS', this became problematic if you wanted to add more
than one value.

By removing the " " this is resolved.

Change-Id: I1351fddbdfd09f0a1a5eeef4afb44679bd39cd63
(cherry picked from commit 07817a412c6473a812c9c0a7014e45eba5c62a30)

commit_message:
Propose specification for oslo.limit library

This change explains the reasoning behind creating a new library to
help other services consume unified limit information in keystone.

commit_message:
Change default_disk value

CONF.default_disk's default value = -1 is just a work around
with no support disk quota fetature [1]. Now, we have an
actual fix [2] so we can change the default_disk value.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548508/4/zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py@313
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549710/

Change-Id: I80b67b73b1f5b45c06f4482e564a6440e7f5e64f

commit_message:
Log health manager exceptions

The executor will hide any unhandled exceptions raised from the update_health
or update_stats methods. This patch updates the health manager to log those
exceptions.

(cherry picked from commit 24cd0070759fe094430d809167b2aa4964107a70)

Change-Id: I80fe5f49ddfc882b7d122048a6eb2e918aea8198

subject: Use local container meta-data
messages:
[{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-18 07:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-18 15:42:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-18 18:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-18 18:43:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-18 07:24:18.000000000', 'message': "Use local container meta-data

The current lxc meta-data process is one where we download an archive
from the upstream lxc images and store it locally on the host. While the
archive is small, this is a process that can break due to transient
networking issues and is an external dependency that we don't need.

The meta-data for the containers we build is all the same between
distros so it's easy to replicate and maintain as a local dependency.
This change creates a templates meta-data folder and stores our
required meta-data items within it. With this change we'll ensure
all containers are built with the same capabilities without requiring
access to an upstream repo and will improve the general speed of
deployment due to the task simplification and removal of an external
dependency.

Change-Id: I999d7068ce05645c477408fbd40556427c202a40
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-03-18 18:10:21.000000000', 'message': "Use local container meta-data

The current lxc meta-data process is one where we download an archive
from the upstream lxc images and store it locally on the host. While the
archive is small, this is a process that can break due to transient
networking issues and is an external dependency that we don't need.

The meta-data for the containers we build is all the same between
distros so it's easy to replicate and maintain as a local dependency.
This change creates a templates meta-data folder and stores our
required meta-data items within it. With this change we'll ensure
all containers are built with the same capabilities without requiring
access to an upstream repo and will improve the general speed of
deployment due to the task simplification and removal of an external
dependency.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use local container meta-data

The current lxc meta-data process is one where we download an archive
from the upstream lxc images and store it locally on the host. While the
archive is small, this is a process that can break due to transient
networking issues and is an external dependency that we don't need.

The meta-data for the containers we build is all the same between
distros so it's easy to replicate and maintain as a local dependency.
This change creates a templates meta-data folder and stores our
required meta-data items within it. With this change we'll ensure
all containers are built with the same capabilities without requiring
access to an upstream repo and will improve the general speed of
deployment due to the task simplification and removal of an external
dependency.

Change-Id: I999d7068ce05645c477408fbd40556427c202a40
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Ensure get-occ-config waits on very slow undercloud.

On very slow undercloud with a lot swap, we may have the stacks
variable empty.  We want to wait a bit before going on to make sure
it's there.  We give up after 180s.

Change-Id: Idd8b588f74f9a29549cedaf432001875440aeb32

subject: Collect physical host facts if missing
messages: [{'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-19 03:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:01:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 03:40:41.000000000', 'message': "Collect physical host facts if missing

Allow the role to collect facts for the physical host if missing,
since the role has a hard dependency on checking the physical host's
kernel version.

In the OSA container create playbook[1], facts are collected only
if the physical host itself is included in the playbook scope. When
a '--limit containername' parameter is used, no physical host facts
are collected and the role fails with:

The conditional check 'hostvars[physical_host]['ansible_kernel'] |
version_compare('3.18.0-0-generic', '<')' failed. The error was:
Version comparison: 'dict object' has no attribute 'ansible_kernel'

Change-Id: Id84aefed6c0129909cb6153258863564c7cc914a
"}]
commit_message:
Collect physical host facts if missing

Allow the role to collect facts for the physical host if missing,
since the role has a hard dependency on checking the physical host's
kernel version.

In the OSA container create playbook[1], facts are collected only
if the physical host itself is included in the playbook scope. When
a '--limit containername' parameter is used, no physical host facts
are collected and the role fails with:

The conditional check 'hostvars[physical_host]['ansible_kernel'] |
version_compare('3.18.0-0-generic', '<')' failed. The error was:
Version comparison: 'dict object' has no attribute 'ansible_kernel'

Change-Id: Id84aefed6c0129909cb6153258863564c7cc914a

subject: Remove generic default interfaces
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-17 06:56:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-17 14:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-17 23:00:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-17 06:56:59.000000000', 'message': 'Remove generic default interfaces

With the implementation of networkd the ENI scripts and config files for
the default interfaces shipped with the lxc container images we use is
no longer useful. These old files can cause conflicts in networking
should the old scripts and networkd get confused especially when it
comes to an interface that is setup for DHCP. This change simply removes
the default interfaces for cent, suse, and ubuntu are removed.

Change-Id: I59fa50216fca320be6643585159fcb72c1925a2f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove generic default interfaces

With the implementation of networkd the ENI scripts and config files for
the default interfaces shipped with the lxc container images we use is
no longer useful. These old files can cause conflicts in networking
should the old scripts and networkd get confused especially when it
comes to an interface that is setup for DHCP. This change simply removes
the default interfaces for cent, suse, and ubuntu are removed.

Change-Id: I59fa50216fca320be6643585159fcb72c1925a2f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Increase sleep time in testsuite to make it more robust

This helps on loaded machines (and such fix the build on s390 in
openSUSE).
Thanks to R. Oertel for providing the fix.

Change-Id: Ia6b9c8f32e2a9d5c2cec826ec26959fba125e181

commit_message:
Add docs about image member notifications

Glance has missed information about notification events for image
member in docs(image.member.create, image.member.update,
image.member.delete). The patch has fixed it so notification docs
contain info about image member events and notification payload
for them.

Partial-Bug: #1612815
Change-Id: I7e3df252643107beea0b208103c90949097241c8

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.18

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I6664cfc05fc7456665a94cb9325cba4325cfa8bd
Change-Id: I537fec0fb76b1ad187232380bbd6d48b520f35c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 02:01:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add host info to instance action events

Currently, the admins can use instance action API to look up the
instance actions info, it is very useful for admins. But the
host info of events are not recorded and not exposed to user.

This host info helps admins to find the host of events
occurring, especially, when some failed events happened, the
admins can find the failed host and log as soon as possible.

This blueprint proposes to add ``host`` field to
``InstanceActionEvent`` object and related API responses.

Change-Id: I8534bd637e19eda66a901444f36394794078926b

commit_message:
Add host info to instance action events

Currently, the admins can use instance action API to look up the
instance actions info, it is very useful for admins. But the
host info of events are not recorded and not exposed to user.

This host info helps admins to find the host of events
occurring, especially, when some failed events happened, the
admins can find the failed host and log as soon as possible.

We propose to add ``host`` field to
``InstanceActionEvent`` object and related API responses.

APIImpact

Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I8534bd637e19eda66a901444f36394794078926b
Blueprint: add-host-to-instance-action-events

subject: Spec: report client placement version discovery
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-03-02 11:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-06 11:09:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

This is good, my comments within are mostly gentle joshing about people not liking HTTP.

The main factor that's important to remember in all of this is that we _always_ want to be making an explicitly versioned request, as that's the "best practice" for talking to a microversioned API.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-03-13 13:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I have a question about cache invalidation.
Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-03-14 16:24:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm of the opinion that the version negotiation and 406-handling behaviour we have now in the placement client is just fine. While it's true that it might be inefficient for some period of time if the client side is updated before placement, it's not a big deal IMHO, and is, as @cdent mentions, the appropriate negotiating behaviour of HTTP.

@gibi's question about when the cached max microversion would be re-validated goes to show that caching this small piece of information will likely just lead to more cache invalidation code for little benefit over the existing code, IMHO.

-jay

-jay"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-03-14 21:57:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

> I'm of the opinion that the version negotiation and 406-handling behaviour we have now in the placement client is just fine. While it's true that it might be inefficient for some period of time if the client side is updated before placement, it's not a big deal IMHO

If this doesn't have support, I can submit a patch to remove the long-standing comment at [1].  Let's get some more opinions, shall we?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9e328b7bb40fb3552d269a70fb03d375f21abe7e/nova/scheduler/client/report.py#L270"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

negotiation via 406 is deemed copacetic.

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_scheduler/2018/nova_scheduler.2018-03-19-14.00.log.html#l-209'}]

commit_message:
Spec: report client placement version discovery

Perform API version discovery up front (when the REST client is created)
in the Nova scheduler report client, and use the discovered versions to
inform subsequent logical branching decisions therein.

Change-Id: I4d033176a2ae836f2ec6b373f956151195557d7c
blueprint: report-client-placement-version-discovery

commit_message:
Add optional healthcheck middleware

This adds the healthcheck middleware from oslo, configurable via the
[healthcheck]/enabled option. This middleware adds a status check at
`/healthcheck`.

This is useful for load balancers to determine if a service is up (and
add or remove it from rotation), or for monitoring tools to see the
health of the server.

This endpoint is unauthenticated, as not all load balancers or
monitoring tools support authenticating with a health check endpoint.

Change-Id: I7929d5f4502c3f84b1cf30526c94a458081a6a29
Closes-Bug: #1748515

commit_message:
Install horizon directly from pypi

It's no longer possible to install horizon with our current
method, and it's causing the ci to fail.
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128310.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553627/
Change-Id: I998fbec953dc4754c81e5ed75e9481d670429019

commit_message:
oslo.db 4.35.0

oslo.db 4.34.0 broke some consuming projects that relied on the
fixtures provided for testing.  We need a new oslo.db release with
the recent requirements fix to address this.

Change-Id: I03d9f67a8015ecec0a0627dd3eef998c3eb56534
Related-Bug: 1756352

commit_message:
Map object returns iterator not list

In Python 3 a map object returns an iterator, not a list, and therefore,
it shall be converted.

Change-Id: Iecfdcb92805e9b8a9a4746241a98410c2c2a6689

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 16:35:41.000000000', 'message': 'Unable to use MongoDB cluster feature

By Trove design, MongoDB cluster creates multiple instances:
  - 3 replicas
  - 3 configsvr (depending Trove configuration)
  - 1 sharding (depending Trove configuration)

When an additional network is used during the creation process
(so not only the Trove management network), the 7 instances will not
be able to communicate across each other to perform the MongoDB
replication actions.

Explanations:
  - 3 replicas connected to management network and tenant network
  - 3 configsvr connected only to management network
  - 1 sharding connected only to management network

With this current design, the sharding node will not be able to
connect to the replica nodes and so the cluster will never works.

This change add the tenant network to all MongoDB instances.

Change-Id: I2f2372cf669ae5ac6044a53fef3ac6fae31fcd70
Closes-Bug: #1748458
'}, {'created': '2018-02-12 14:55:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add multiple networks to MongoDB cluster

  - 3 configsvr connected only to management network
  - 1 sharding connected only to management network

With this current design, the sharding node will not be able to

Change-Id: I2f2372cf669ae5ac6044a53fef3ac6fae31fcd70
Closes-Bug: #1748458
'}]
commit_message:
Add multiple networks to MongoDB cluster

By Trove design, MongoDB cluster creates multiple instances:
  - 3 replicas
  - 3 configsvr (depending Trove configuration)
  - 1 sharding (depending Trove configuration)

When an additional network is used during the creation process
(so not only the Trove management network), the 7 instances will not
be able to communicate across each other to perform the MongoDB
replication actions.

Explanations:
  - 3 replicas connected to management network and tenant network
  - 3 configsvr connected only to management network
  - 1 sharding connected only to management network

With this current design, the sharding node will not be able to
connect to the replica nodes and so the cluster will never works.

This change add the tenant network to all MongoDB instances.

Change-Id: I2f2372cf669ae5ac6044a53fef3ac6fae31fcd70
Closes-Bug: #1748458

commit_message:
Improve the Docker integration

* Removed old scripts
* Added docker-compose files
* Added .dockerignore
* Updated Docker docs
* Added cloud-flow container to docker-compose
* PostgreSQL and MySQL were supported

Change-Id: Ia7b6d7faaff6d9aa0f02d64d569250f6a9ee59ea
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-14 10:32:01.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure not to swallow original exceptions on handling remote errors

* Also removed a custom initializer of SizeLimitExceededException with
  3 parameters in favor of creating a static method because we
  have to assume that all MistralException classes have an initializer
  with only one parameter "message" to be able to restore an exception
  on the RPC client which was raised on the RPC server.

Change-Id: Idd52bb7bb18168826644d8aaca3d96be46f8ae9e
Closes-Bug: #1750752
(cherry picked from commit 3e042238886e9a3640469423bbdf241832233b7e)
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure not to swallow original exceptions on handling remote errors

* Also removed a custom initializer of SizeLimitExceededException with
  3 parameters in favor of creating a static method because we
  have to assume that all MistralException classes have an initializer
  with only one parameter "message" to be able to restore an exception
  on the RPC client which was raised on the RPC server.

Change-Id: Idd52bb7bb18168826644d8aaca3d96be46f8ae9e
Closes-Bug: #1750752
(cherry picked from commit 3e042238886e9a3640469423bbdf241832233b7e)

subject: Add CentOS deployment support
messages:
[{'account_id': 27941, 'date': '2018-03-12 18:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-03-12 18:22:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Add CentOS deployment support

Add the necessary vars file for CentOS support, and adjust the role
to ensure that the variables are picked up and the role is tested on
CentOS.

Change-Id: I2d99c57c5e00c9805aaeac0e7e2f173ff3b69837
Closes-Bug: 1755253

[{'account_id': 26472, 'date': '2017-12-05 02:14:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-05 02:14:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2017-12-05 02:20:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add functionality to define different Message and Notification destination

Sometime,huge notification messages will effect the rabbitMQ cluster's
performance.This commit adds functionality do define different Message
and Notification destination.

Closes-Bug: #1734823
Change-Id: I2ef4d008c9ca91a03d8c7e1380e0188bf6792595

commit_message:
Port CreateAndListLoadbalancers for Octavia

This is still a WIP.
Ia7a83ebe37a49e58400620b7ed3dedac209664f8 added Octavia client support.
This patch merely ports the existing load balancer (v2) scenario
to use Octavia as an OpenStack top-level project.

The follow-up patch would be additional CRUD scenarios for load balancer
objects such as load balancer (some actions currently missing), Pools,
Health Monitors etc.

Change-Id: Ia865bbe72bfcfa9d96d7f4b628d8c2e1758d7007

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 18:26:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pip installation on RHEL 7

RHEL 7 curl does not support TLS > 1.0 by default, but
boostrap.pypa.io only supports TLS 1.2. Pass --tlsv1 to curl
when downloading get-pip.py so that curl will always use TLS 1.x.

Change-Id: I25674b5cff82686651369a4f43431bc91dafa5b8
Closes-Bug: #1741097
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pip installation on RHEL 7

RHEL 7 curl does not support TLS > 1.0 by default, but
boostrap.pypa.io only supports TLS 1.2. Pass --tlsv1 to curl
when downloading get-pip.py so that curl will always use TLS 1.x.

Change-Id: I25674b5cff82686651369a4f43431bc91dafa5b8
Closes-Bug: #1741097

(1 comment)

I think I agree with jichen here - except for the part about trying to "fix" all of nova.  The benefit of using the consts is questionable in the case of HTTP codes.  They're long-standing, will never change, and are generally well-known enough that they don't need to be named.  Given that, IMO it's not worth inflating the code (in this case 20c vs 3c).

Case in point, see the inline comment, where we would wind up with a decorator spilling onto two lines.'}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-03-19 13:25:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

To keep the consistency, using http_client.ACCEPTED instead
of 202 in create_backup.py

commit_message:
Use hostnamectl to set the container hostname

This change sets the hostname of containers using the hostnamectl
command which has several enhancements over legacy method. By using
hostnamectl the command will validate the hostname for correctness
ensuring the container hostnames are conforming the the RFC.

The old methods have been removed and the command has been made part of
the handlers and will be run after the activation of dbus.

Change-Id: I158a5deb0685d2dcd436d7dd92caecb9966a025e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Don't share a network with all tenants

Other tenants may appreciate random networks not popping up for
miliseconds in their net-list; and other test cases executed in parallel
may also benefit, especially when they e.g. attempt to validate net-list
result; or boot an instance w/o specifying a port or network to use.

There is still more work on tempest tests side.

Depends-On: I199f639c95e8ae884ede46404370d7b64da3b309
Change-Id: Iba89a53b2715cf3a9c7485f2089f27d547fea308
Closes-Bug: #1753209

commit_message:
Services: Gracefully ignore exposed UDP ports

Since LBaaSv2 doesn't support UDP load balancing,
Kuryr should ignore exposed UDP ports in K8S service.
This patch updates Kuryr to gracefully ignore UDP exposed
ports and updates the documentation with this info.

Closes-Bug: 1736060

Change-Id: I03f6d95a2d855cbd8954018c930e283a46763655
(cherry picked from commit d5e5d1537bc911a893f068d094f057c45444fc40)

[{'created': '2018-03-15 07:16:28.000000000', 'message': 'Services: Rollback openstack resources in case of annotation failure

Upon K8S service creation the LBaaS handler creates all LB resources
at neutron (LB,Listener,Pool,etc) and store them at K8S resource
 using annotation.
When K8S service is deleted, the LBaaS handler retrieves LB
resources details from annotation and release them at neutron.

Change-Id: Iea806d32c99cd3cf51a832b576ff4054fc522bd3
(cherry picked from commit 2e6c7eaae7a198cc169f060351b54e9c0586de11)
'}]
commit_message:
Services: Rollback openstack resources in case of annotation failure

Upon K8S service creation the LBaaS handler creates all LB resources
at neutron (LB,Listener,Pool,etc) and store them at K8S resource
 using annotation.
When K8S service is deleted, the LBaaS handler retrieves LB
resources details from annotation and release them at neutron.

This patch handles the case in which K8S service resource was deleted
before LBaaS handler stored openstack resource details.

Closes-Bug: 1748890

Change-Id: Iea806d32c99cd3cf51a832b576ff4054fc522bd3
(cherry picked from commit 2e6c7eaae7a198cc169f060351b54e9c0586de11)

commit_message:
Creating gate for testing ports pool feature

It's tested on baremetal with lbaasv2.

1) neutron-vif is used for KURYR_POD_VIF_DRIVER.
2) port_pool_enabled in tempest.conf is updated to True

Partially-Implements: blueprint enhance-upstream-gates

Depends-On: I0921cf8a416f79745fb96bb67636eac6ed47a537
Change-Id: I1cb916d527db8d49669a807e66769fbb7c55e8e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 17:02:20.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce interactions by nearly 50%

The container interactions require a couple interactions to address the
container namespace as well as pad the pathing when transmitting a file.
This change reduces those interactions by nearly half for a single task
by storing information about a target container instead of looking it up
for every interaction.

Example file transfer:
  > Before this PR: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691341/
  > After this PR: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691338/

In the example we can see the "Before" runnins 20 commands to transfer
a file to a target while the "After" is running only 11.

Example command:
  > Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691343/
  > After: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691344/

In the command example we can see the "Before" is running 10 commands
to run a single command task while the "After" is running only 6.

This change will improve general ansible performance by cutting down the
number of operations needed to be completed to execute any one task.

Change-Id: Ia8405ec5c3b55ed3f7f134c4882d337c5e0b625f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9dc4ce2a045b704af55176555b8a13c2d85dcf51)
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce interactions by nearly 50%

The container interactions require a couple interactions to address the
container namespace as well as pad the pathing when transmitting a file.
This change reduces those interactions by nearly half for a single task
by storing information about a target container instead of looking it up
for every interaction.

Example file transfer:
  > Before this PR: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691341/
  > After this PR: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691338/

In the example we can see the "Before" runnins 20 commands to transfer
a file to a target while the "After" is running only 11.

Example command:
  > Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691343/
  > After: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691344/

In the command example we can see the "Before" is running 10 commands
to run a single command task while the "After" is running only 6.

This change will improve general ansible performance by cutting down the
number of operations needed to be completed to execute any one task.

Change-Id: Ia8405ec5c3b55ed3f7f134c4882d337c5e0b625f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9dc4ce2a045b704af55176555b8a13c2d85dcf51)

commit_message:
Remove config.get_config()

This was marked for removal in Queens, so it should be safe to do.
oslo.config wants to remove MultiConfigParser and this is a
pre-requisite to that.

Change-Id: If034805fd28712a329c70c10432434cf00324987

commit_message:
Enable by default SCREEN_LOGDIR

Enable the variable SCREEN_LOGDIR as default in
the local.conf. As a team we create and test in
many virtual machines, a many times we forgot to
add this variable, and then need it to check the
logs, when this occurs, we have to restack the
devstack again.

Change-Id: Iad5c78c1b8e9308fcbbe1b2ea61756dc1b46e658

commit_message:
Remove unused minor update code

Since Pike, minor updates are done via the composable services
framework. The old shell script approach hasn't been used/tested for 2
releases now, and should be dropped.

Also drop the UpdateWorkflow interface. Before we started doing
upgrades via Ansible, we used this pluggable resource interface to
perform oneshot operations like migrations to WSGI or AODH
services. Nowadays this interface is not referenced from anywhere and
we'd probably rather do similar operations via Ansible tasks.

Change-Id: I6c5eafe76eb53bc38d100a9ba132dd8fe6dd2d5f

commit_message:
FFU: Add update-from-ceph-newton.yaml

Introduce simple environment file to be included during the final
stack update of a FFU. Contains a list of ceph-ansible playbooks.
Newton's Ceph Jewel will be migrated to containers by the first
playbook and then Ceph will be upgraded to Luminous by the second
playbook.

Change-Id: Id46b07a8dae23ef3b12d656ce250e2959596eaeb
(cherry picked from commit a981dbaf893006e71b6c4702e6dce294ca0aac2e)

commit_message:
Mariadb online upgrade after yum update

During undercloud upgrade, yum can update the mariadb-server package.
If that is the case and the updated package is a major mariadb update
(e.g. 5.5 -> 10.1, or 10.0 -> 10.1), some database system tables might
need to be updated.

Ensure that mysql_upgrade will be run after a major mariadb update.
Also, force-stop the mariadb server before the upgrade to workaround
a rpm scriptlet limitation when going 5.5 -> 10.1.

Change-Id: Iebc3f39cb2dae355124ba39f7653ef8d20baacc6

commit_message:
Containerized undercloud: Enable novajoin if configured

If enable_novajoin is set in the undercloud.conf file, we set the
necessary parameters to start novajoin.

commit_message:
Fix devstack tests

With the change in devstack from neutron-legacy to the new neutron lib
setup, we need to tweak things a bit.

Include neutron devstack plugin, that would have been needed for some
time in order to make the neutron-qos service work.

Depend on octavia change to make its devstack plugin compatible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/544281
Change-Id: I023d76c56d9b72e390bf2c1d39ddc27584d5c52a

[{'created': '2018-02-20 19:05:55.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Rework logic handling reserved orphaned nodes in the conductor

If a conductor dies while holding a reservation, the node can get
stuck in its current state. Currently the conductor that takes
over the node only cleans it up if it's in the DEPLOYING state.

This change applies the same logic for all nodes:

1. Reservation is cleared by the conductor that took over the node
   no matter what provision state.

2. Transient power states are cleared as well.

The reservation is cleared even for nodes in maintenance mode,
otherwise it's impossible to move them out of maintenance.

Change-Id: I379c1335692046ca9423fda5ea68d2f10c065cb5
Closes-Bug: #1588901
"}, {'created': '2018-02-21 13:41:00.000000000', 'message': "Rework logic handling reserved orphaned nodes in the conductor

1. Reservation is cleared by the conductor that took over the node
   no matter what provision state.

2. CLEANING is also aborted, nodes are moved to CLEAN FAIL with

commit_message:
Rework logic handling reserved orphaned nodes in the conductor

If a conductor dies while holding a reservation, the node can get
stuck in its current state. Currently the conductor that takes
over the node only cleans it up if it's in the DEPLOYING state.

This change applies the same logic for all nodes:

1. Reservation is cleared by the conductor that took over the node
   no matter what provision state.

2. CLEANING is also aborted, nodes are moved to CLEAN FAIL with
   maintenance on.

3. Target power state is cleared as well.

The reservation is cleared even for nodes in maintenance mode,
otherwise it's impossible to move them out of maintenance.

Change-Id: I379c1335692046ca9423fda5ea68d2f10c065cb5
Closes-Bug: #1588901

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 10:33:02.000000000', 'message': 'test-ansible-env-prep: Fix ARA installation for tests

Ansible expects $HOME/.ansible/plugins/callback to contain all the
callback plugins instead of one directory per plugin. As such, since we
only make use of a single callback plugin (ARA), symlink that directory
to where ARA is installed.

Change-Id: I21dc0ca559f69c5a28adba01e442f667740c2c10
'}]
commit_message:
test-ansible-env-prep: Fix ARA installation for tests

Ansible expects $HOME/.ansible/plugins/callback to contain all the
callback plugins instead of one directory per plugin. As such, since we
only make use of a single callback plugin (ARA), symlink that directory
to where ARA is installed.

Change-Id: I21dc0ca559f69c5a28adba01e442f667740c2c10

[{'created': '2018-03-19 08:56:08.000000000', 'message': "Use the good configuration directive for memcache servers

Under Pike, both the backend argument and memcache_servers work.
They both end-up with connections to the backend of memcache.

The latter doesn't have the bug when multiple servers are given,
though. So let's use this one exclusively.

This massive template change is for backwards compatibility:
If a deployer has set on of those keystone variables, the servers
used won't change.

Change-Id: I7e29aa0a9055b737dd4cf171c40e2105e4b32e94
Related-Bug: #1743036
(cherry picked from commit e87e2bd737467d4d1c1225f52cb7fad5a4d2cd5d)
"}]
commit_message:
Use the good configuration directive for memcache servers

Under Pike, both the backend argument and memcache_servers work.
They both end-up with connections to the backend of memcache.

The latter doesn't have the bug when multiple servers are given,
though. So let's use this one exclusively.

This massive template change is for backwards compatibility:
If a deployer has set on of those keystone variables, the servers
used won't change.

Change-Id: I7e29aa0a9055b737dd4cf171c40e2105e4b32e94
Related-Bug: #1743036
(cherry picked from commit e87e2bd737467d4d1c1225f52cb7fad5a4d2cd5d)

commit_message:
Adds fast_forward_upgrade_tasks for Heat services

Adds ffu tasks for the heat services -api, -api-cfn,
-api-cloudwatch and -engine under systemd are stopped
and also disabled (e.g. to be containerized, migrated httpd etc).
Services stopped step 1, package update step 6, dbsync step8.

Change-Id: Ida0b4cb7f6f0a9d966e2a79dd05460565d98aaf9
(cherry picked from commit fa66d68c081d98f8de1b2d5a0574263f0a7679b0)

commit_message:
Check if undercloud is rebooted.

Running 'reboot' is not enough, cause during high load it takes
 longer to shutdown all the services.
In this case reboot command was sent to server, and immediately
 after it SSH port was checked, though without guarantee if node
was rebooted or not.

Change-Id: Ia8ba045f5b0d25a7c28a0a3dbf49d56c446e4fc3
(cherry picked from commit Ia8ba045f5b0d25a7c28a0a3dbf49d56c446e4fc3)
(cherry picked from commit 5ba5341dc00266f26b8a28ed3f2eab055371e952)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 09:25:12.000000000', 'message': 'Stop inventory constantly giving containers new IP

See bug for further details, this was affecting pike after applying
the backported patch.

As the bug mentions, some containers were constantly given new IPs,
even with no changes to user_variables yml files or
openstack_user_config.yml file.

Further to the bug, I think that the code in master/patch will
cause containers to receive new IPs when network settings are
changed (bridge, mtu, type) rather than just updating that setting.

Change-Id: I0a757e9f503d3f604b2ba2c3409b4a4507d5edff
Closes-Bug: 1756091
'}]
commit_message:
Stop inventory constantly giving containers new IP

See bug for further details, this was affecting pike after applying
the backported patch.

As the bug mentions, some containers were constantly given new IPs,
even with no changes to user_variables yml files or
openstack_user_config.yml file.

Further to the bug, I think that the code in master/patch will
cause containers to receive new IPs when network settings are
changed (bridge, mtu, type) rather than just updating that setting.

Change-Id: I0a757e9f503d3f604b2ba2c3409b4a4507d5edff
Closes-Bug: 1756091

commit_message:
Move the roles defined in meta to tasks

Defining roles in the meta directory is not recommended because of performance
and flexibility. It is better to define them as normal tasks and that's what
this patch does

Change-Id: I932fa228f994db975db3b80129a22a20896bd3ef
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

the error is:
(Pdb) neutron_port['security_groups']
*** KeyError: 'security_groups'

commit_message:
security_groups can not be None

security_groups is a list variable, but the way to judge is
‘if security_groups is None’

this should be modified
Closes-Bug: #1749400

commit_message:
Remove /lib/udev in $PATH for nova-compute

Add /lib/udev environment variable[1] is to solve the scsi_id access
problems, but the patch[2][3] pointed out the absolute path scsi_id,
we can not add /lib/udev environment variables in the system for
nova-compute. So we can remove /lib/udev in $PATH for nova-compute.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291285/
[2]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277224/
[3]https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py#L147

Change-Id: I5326edf8fff5745ef119c0c3decd6f4c51e8bd5d
Closes-Bug: #1742340
(cherry picked from commit 097b4da85d81a2ce892ffbc208dc5710b519441c)

commit_message:
Remove /lib/udev in $PATH for nova-compute

Add /lib/udev environment variable[1] is to solve the scsi_id access
problems, but the patch[2][3] pointed out the absolute path scsi_id,
we can not add /lib/udev environment variables in the system for
nova-compute. So we can remove /lib/udev in $PATH for nova-compute.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291285/
[2]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277224/
[3]https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py#L147

Change-Id: I5326edf8fff5745ef119c0c3decd6f4c51e8bd5d
Closes-Bug: #1742340
(cherry picked from commit 097b4da85d81a2ce892ffbc208dc5710b519441c)

Remove the unnecessary "openstack-neutron-lbaas" from neutron-server

since openstack-neutron-lbaas has beed installed in neutron-base image,
it's no need to install it again install neutron-server.

commit_message:
Increase the post-timeout to 3600 seconds

The default post-timeout is 1800, which is not enough to push images to
hub.docker.com.

Change-Id: If1e499c247f3eeb8452991cb18aea5b1fdad60a7
Closes-Bug: #1755416
(cherry picked from commit 864965c40044cab1e459e4f8692473940497be3f)

hub.docker.com.
