subject: Add proposal "alarm-merge-rule"
messages:
[{'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-02-26 08:14:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-02-26 08:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-02-26 08:36:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21414, 'date': '2018-02-26 10:34:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-02-27 02:25:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)

We plan to replace current status with merged status, and drop the previous current status and new status.
The proposal doesn't involve in the details of implementing for now."}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-02-28 05:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-03-01 12:12:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

Hi, please see my comments inline. And some general comments:

How will we know which alarms should be merged? do you plan to modify the equivalence template so a similar syntax will be used for alarm merge rules? 

Suppose there is "high CPU load on host" alarm from Zabbix with a deduced alarm on the instance and "high cpu load on instance" alarm from Aodh. Should these two alarms be merged? how do you determine that they should be merged? what component in Vitrage should be responsible for the merge? 

Note that you should be able to identify the Aodh alarm by the details of the deduced alarm and vice versa.

I'll be happy to see a low level detailed design, in addition to the general explanation. Because I'm afraid the implementation is not trivial.'}, {'account_id': 24667, 'date': '2018-03-02 11:09:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Peipei is absent today :-)
I will introduce an example to represent how we think and design, the example is consider to be a philosophy for us.
When a patient go to see a doctor, what will the doctor do?
When a patient comes, he will told symptom to doctor, and probably he will also bring inspection report inspected by other hospital before.
The doctor will classify these information, whether the words patient speak or report he brings. As for the report, doctor only focus on the result, without concerning which hospital the report comes from. For example, “percent of leucocyte in blood”, if there are two reports about it from hospital A and hospital B, the doctor will combine the two result as one final indicator, not two indicators.
Then the doctor will make some judgments by his experience(templates are experience in vitrage). He will told patient to do some inspection before he makes a final conclusion, when his judgment is conflict with the reports he gets. (That is why we choose to trust ‘report’ more than ‘deduce’)
The conflict between experience and report may be due to expiry of report. (The report may be produced 2 weeks ago)
The example above can give us a reference when we are in doubt to think and design, and it also help us to explain why the table in bp is like this.
Other comments will be given later.'}, {'account_id': 24667, 'date': '2018-03-03 09:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

In current implementaion in vitrage, if two alarms has the same properties including 'vitrage_type', 'alarm_name' and 'resource_id', 
they will be considered as a same graph vertex
However, in this 'alarm-merge-rule' blueprint we propose, we advise to remove 'vitrage_type'.
That means whether 'vitrage_type' is 'nagios' or 'vitrage', they both point a same vertex, and then will be merged.
So, the result of usecase above is: "high CPU load" on instance(deduced) will by merged with "high cpu load on instance" from Aodh.
This will be implemented in PROCESSOR module.
Even more, when two alarms reported by different monitors(one nagios,the other zabbix), and they have same 'alarm_name' and 'resource_id'
they will be merged as well because of the 'doctor-example' philosophy'}, {'account_id': 24667, 'date': '2018-03-03 10:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-03-05 11:08:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> In current implementaion in vitrage, if two alarms has the same
 > properties including 'vitrage_type', 'alarm_name' and
 > 'resource_id',
 > they will be considered as a same graph vertex
 > However, in this 'alarm-merge-rule' blueprint we propose, we advise
 > to remove 'vitrage_type'.
 > That means whether 'vitrage_type' is 'nagios' or 'vitrage', they
 > both point a same vertex, and then will be merged.
 > So, the result of usecase above is: "high CPU load" on
 > instance(deduced) will by merged with "high cpu load on instance"
 > from Aodh.
 > This will be implemented in PROCESSOR module.
 > Even more, when two alarms reported by different monitors(one
 > nagios,the other zabbix), and they have same 'alarm_name' and
 > 'resource_id'
 > they will be merged as well because of the 'doctor-example'
 > philosophy

A few issues regarding merging two alarms from two different monitors: 

1. In the example above, the names of the two alarms are slightly different, although they represent the same thing. So just omitting the vitrage_type will not help you merge them. 

2. The behavior that you suggest has a hidden assumption that all monitors are equally reliable. Is this always the case? what if there are two alarms with the same name, generated by two different monitors, but one of them performs better tests (think of MRI vs. ultrasound scanning ;-)). I assume that in this case you will not want to merge them. Actually, I assume that in most cases you will not want to merge real monitored alarms.

3. So - we must have a mechanism that lets the user define which alarms should be merged.

Regarding the monitored alarms vs. deduced alarms - I'll think it over and reply later'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-05 12:17:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-05 12:18:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-06 05:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> > In current implementaion in vitrage, if two alarms has the same
 > > properties including 'vitrage_type', 'alarm_name' and
 > > 'resource_id',
 > > they will be considered as a same graph vertex
 > > However, in this 'alarm-merge-rule' blueprint we propose, we
 > advise
 > > to remove 'vitrage_type'.
 > > That means whether 'vitrage_type' is 'nagios' or 'vitrage', they
 > > both point a same vertex, and then will be merged.
 > > So, the result of usecase above is: "high CPU load" on
 > > instance(deduced) will by merged with "high cpu load on instance"
 > > from Aodh.
 > > This will be implemented in PROCESSOR module.
 > > Even more, when two alarms reported by different monitors(one
 > > nagios,the other zabbix), and they have same 'alarm_name' and
 > > 'resource_id'
 > > they will be merged as well because of the 'doctor-example'
 > > philosophy
 > 
 > A few issues regarding merging two alarms from two different
 > monitors:
 > 
 > 1. In the example above, the names of the two alarms are slightly
 > different, although they represent the same thing. So just omitting
 > the vitrage_type will not help you merge them.
 > 
 > 2. The behavior that you suggest has a hidden assumption that all
 > monitors are equally reliable. Is this always the case? what if
 > there are two alarms with the same name, generated by two different
 > monitors, but one of them performs better tests (think of MRI vs.
 > ultrasound scanning ;-)). I assume that in this case you will not
 > want to merge them. Actually, I assume that in most cases you will
 > not want to merge real monitored alarms.
 > 
 > 3. So - we must have a mechanism that lets the user define which
 > alarms should be merged.
 > 
 > Regarding the monitored alarms vs. deduced alarms - I'll think it
 > over and reply later

 > > In current implementaion in vitrage, if two alarms has the same
 > > properties including 'vitrage_type', 'alarm_name' and
 > > 'resource_id',
 > > they will be considered as a same graph vertex
 > > However, in this 'alarm-merge-rule' blueprint we propose, we
 > advise
 > > to remove 'vitrage_type'.
 > > That means whether 'vitrage_type' is 'nagios' or 'vitrage', they
 > > both point a same vertex, and then will be merged.
 > > So, the result of usecase above is: "high CPU load" on
 > > instance(deduced) will by merged with "high cpu load on instance"
 > > from Aodh.
 > > This will be implemented in PROCESSOR module.
 > > Even more, when two alarms reported by different monitors(one
 > > nagios,the other zabbix), and they have same 'alarm_name' and
 > > 'resource_id'
 > > they will be merged as well because of the 'doctor-example'
 > > philosophy
 > 
 > A few issues regarding merging two alarms from two different
 > monitors:
 > 
 > 1. In the example above, the names of the two alarms are slightly
 > different, although they represent the same thing. So just omitting
 > the vitrage_type will not help you merge them.
 > 
 > 2. The behavior that you suggest has a hidden assumption that all
 > monitors are equally reliable. Is this always the case? what if
 > there are two alarms with the same name, generated by two different
 > monitors, but one of them performs better tests (think of MRI vs.
 > ultrasound scanning ;-)). I assume that in this case you will not
 > want to merge them. Actually, I assume that in most cases you will
 > not want to merge real monitored alarms.
 > 
 > 3. So - we must have a mechanism that lets the user define which
 > alarms should be merged.
 > 

I think your opinion about merging two alarms from different monitors make sense. Removing 'vitrage_type' from create_entity_key for alarm toughly may be not appropriate, regarding the issues above. 
However, in case users just want one single alarm if alarms point to the samething(like only MRI results), I agree with you that we can have a mechanism. 
In the mechanism, users can define which alarms should be merged, even if their names may be different and come from different monitors. And they can also define nothing in the mechanism, of course, if they don't want to merge reported alarms from different monitors.'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-06 05:05:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Regarding the monitored alarms vs. deduced alarms - I'll think it
 > over and reply later

Regarding merging between monitored and deduced alarm, we plan to modify the 'vitrage_type' of deduced alarm to be same with its root alarm, and add a property like 'method' to mark it's reported or deduced. Property 'method' will also be used, when compare current and new status of alarm to trigger a diagnose action."}, {'account_id': 24667, 'date': '2018-03-06 09:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I explain why we always insist on 'merge alarms between different source(Nagios, Zabbix, Vitrage)'.
The main reason is the high complexity of implementation for 'Evaluator' module if we don't merge them.
If we just merge 'Report' and 'Deduce', but don't merge 'Nagions-Report' and 'Zabbix-Report', what should we do when 3 alarms(Nagios, Zabbix, Vitrage) come together. It seems we can't solve the problem easily.
However, I understand the issues what you mentioned above, 
and we agree it's a good method to provide mechanism for users when they want to regard some alarms as one vertex."}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-08 11:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-03-11 08:21:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

> I explain why we always insist on 'merge alarms between different
 > source(Nagios, Zabbix, Vitrage)'.
 > The main reason is the high complexity of implementation for
 > 'Evaluator' module if we don't merge them.
 > If we just merge 'Report' and 'Deduce', but don't merge
 > 'Nagions-Report' and 'Zabbix-Report', what should we do when 3
 > alarms(Nagios, Zabbix, Vitrage) come together. It seems we can't
 > solve the problem easily.
 > However, I understand the issues what you mentioned above,
 > and we agree it's a good method to provide mechanism for users when
 > they want to regard some alarms as one vertex.

I agree that the evaluator complexity is a big issue. I'm now trying to solve the problem for equivalent resources, and I hope we can come up with a unified design for both cases."}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-03-11 08:23:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Regarding merging between monitored and deduced alarm, we plan to
 > modify the 'vitrage_type' of deduced alarm to be same with its root
 > alarm, and add a property like 'method' to mark it's reported or
 > deduced. Property 'method' will also be used, when compare current
 > and new status of alarm to trigger a diagnose action.

I don't think that Vitrage should "pretend" to send Zabbix alarms. The user will
then go to Zabbix and see that the alarm is OK, while in Vitrage it appears to be 
in CRITICAL severity...  and what if you have both Zabbix and Nagios?'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-03-12 08:13:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi, I have a new idea for resource and alarm merge. 

How about we keep *all* properties of the equivalent entities on the same vertex. We can do it if we prepend the datasource type to every property name (this can be done automatically in the processor). This way, we will have vitrage_state, nagios_state, zabbix_state, nagios_update_timestamp, zabbix_update_timestamp, etc.

We should decide if and how to aggregate this information in the API. We can use the aggregation mode that you suggested (aggregate latest / more credible).

The advantages that I see in this solution are:

1. It is simple

2. We don't lose any information. Nothing is overwritten.

3. No change is needed in the evaluator. The mechanism that duplicates scenarios will no longer be needed.


The required changes will be:

* In the processor (prepend the datasource type to every entity property)

* n the template loading (prepend the datasource type to every entity property)

* In the aggregated state calculation 

* Defining the equivalence/binding rules. We need this part in any solution we chose.

* The tricky part - add/remove vertex: sometimes instead of add vertex, we will need to identify the equivalent vertex and add new properties to it. And instead of remove vertex, we will need to remove the specific datasource properties and keep the other properties. 


What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-12 08:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-12 08:50:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

> (2 comments) 
 > I agree that the evaluator complexity is a big issue. I'm now
 > trying to solve the problem for equivalent resources, and I hope we
 > can come up with a unified design for both cases."}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-12 08:54:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Ok. We keep 'vitrage' type for deduced alarms. And if users don't define 'bind', monitored alarm and deduced alarm will not be merged. It's backward compatible."}, {'account_id': 24667, 'date': '2018-03-12 10:15:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Hi, I have a new idea for resource and alarm merge.
 > 
 > How about we keep *all* properties of the equivalent entities on
 > the same vertex. We can do it if we prepend the datasource type to
 > every property name (this can be done automatically in the
 > processor). This way, we will have vitrage_state, nagios_state,
 > zabbix_state, nagios_update_timestamp, zabbix_update_timestamp,
 > etc.
 > 
 > We should decide if and how to aggregate this information in the
 > API. We can use the aggregation mode that you suggested (aggregate
 > latest / more credible).
 > 
 > The advantages that I see in this solution are:
 > 
 > 1. It is simple
 > 
 > 2. We don't lose any information. Nothing is overwritten.
 > 
 > 3. No change is needed in the evaluator. The mechanism that
 > duplicates scenarios will no longer be needed.
 > 
 > 
 > The required changes will be:
 > 
 > * In the processor (prepend the datasource type to every entity
 > property)
 > 
 > * n the template loading (prepend the datasource type to every
 > entity property)
 > 
 > * In the aggregated state calculation
 > 
 > * Defining the equivalence/binding rules. We need this part in any
 > solution we chose.
 > 
 > * The tricky part - add/remove vertex: sometimes instead of add
 > vertex, we will need to identify the equivalent vertex and add new
 > properties to it. And instead of remove vertex, we will need to
 > remove the specific datasource properties and keep the other
 > properties.
 > 
 > 
 > What do you think?

Keeping all properties is OK. But there may be some detail to consider for how to keep them.
1. Will the properties such as 'alarm_name', 'is_deleted', 'resource_id' be prepended? 
   They seem to be the common properties in different datasource type.
2. Though there are several properties to be duplicated such as 'state', 'severity' and 'timestamp', 
   they should be combined to 'one' summary result for user to view and for evaluator to work.
   So, do you plan to add another property for each item such as 'summary_state', 'summary_timestamp'... ?
   That is to say, we need to keep a set of properties to save the winner in the 'merge-rule', shall we?
3. Add/remove vertex: 'add' seems ok, but for 'remove', do you want to remove the vertex only when all the datasource reports OK?
	 It is the same question as before in another rst we discuss, but it seems we didn't reach an agreement yet.
4. I have another advise that keep the tuple('state', 'severity', 'timestamp',...) as an event stream in a new property called 'history'
	 whether it is reported or recover. The 'history' is a list to record key infomation of alarms, and it won't lose any infomation too.
	 It looks like a doctor paste all the inspection reports together on the 'medical history'."}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-03-12 12:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-03-12 13:04:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Keeping all properties is OK. But there may be some detail to
 > consider for how to keep them.
 > 1. Will the properties such as 'alarm_name', 'is_deleted',
 > 'resource_id' be prepended?
 > They seem to be the common properties in different datasource type.
 > 2. Though there are several properties to be duplicated such as
 > 'state', 'severity' and 'timestamp',
 > they should be combined to 'one' summary result for user to view
 > and for evaluator to work.
 > So, do you plan to add another property for each item such as
 > 'summary_state', 'summary_timestamp'... ?
 > That is to say, we need to keep a set of properties to save the
 > winner in the 'merge-rule', shall we?
 > 3. Add/remove vertex: 'add' seems ok, but for 'remove', do you want
 > to remove the vertex only when all the datasource reports OK?
 > It is the same question as before in another rst we discuss, but it
 > seems we didn't reach an agreement yet.
 > 4. I have another advise that keep the tuple('state', 'severity',
 > 'timestamp',...) as an event stream in a new property called
 > 'history'
 > whether it is reported or recover. The 'history' is a list to
 > record key infomation of alarms, and it won't lose any infomation
 > too.
 > It looks like a doctor paste all the inspection reports together on
 > the 'medical history'.

1. The same alarm can have a slightly different name in Zabbix and Nagios, so 'alarm_name' should be prepended. 'is_deleted' is used internally by Vitrage, it is not a datasource property, so it will not be prepended. 'resource_id' should not be a property at all, personally I would like to delete it. We know the resource id from looking at the 'on' edge of the alarm.

2. I'm not sure if we need to save the 'winner'. We might let the API code calculate it on-the-fly from the properties that exist at the time of the call. The detailed design should describe the exact behavior and how different properties should be handled.

3. Yes, I would like to remove the vertex only if datasources report 'OK'. But on another blueprint you raised an idea to let the user determine that the winner will be by credibility, and in this case if the monitor reports OK and Vitrage reports not-ok we might indeed delete the vertex. 

4. We have discussed ideas for keeping alarm history in the PTG, you can see it in the etherpad. We have already started implementing the infrastructure for it. However, using the history for the case that one monitor changes the severity to OK has a too big overhead. The vitrage-graph infrastructure is not built to work this way."}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-13 12:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-03-13 12:30:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-14 00:59:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24667, 'date': '2018-03-14 02:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)

I try to explain what xupeipei means.:) 
The identifier for a resource vertex include three items: ‘RESOURCE’, vitrage_type, and a lable.
The lable is different in different datasources, for example, lable is 'instance_id' or 'id' in nova.instance, and 'host_name' in nova.host.
The point in the vitrage code is implemented in function: '_create_entity_key' in private method.
Only when the three items are all the same, the entities will combine a same vertex.
Firstly, ‘RESOURCE’ text is always same, so it's ok.
Secondly, vitrage_type will be different, but user have chance to define binding for them in 'bind section' of the template.
Finally, lable will be generated in 'transformer' in different datasource, as long as lable is generated the same string, it's unnecessary to define which field is label in template.
That is to say, we don't need to define "equals(get_attr(nova_instance, 'id'), get_attr(k8s_instance, 'externalID'))", which is guarenteed by datasource.
The key point is that, datasource must be responsible for creating same label string among binding monitors.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-03-14 07:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> I try to explain what xupeipei means.:)
 > The identifier for a resource vertex include three items:
 > ‘RESOURCE’, vitrage_type, and a lable.
 > The lable is different in different datasources, for example, lable
 > is 'instance_id' or 'id' in nova.instance, and 'host_name' in
 > nova.host.
 > The point in the vitrage code is implemented in function:
 > '_create_entity_key' in private method.
 > Only when the three items are all the same, the entities will
 > combine a same vertex.
 > Firstly, ‘RESOURCE’ text is always same, so it's ok.
 > Secondly, vitrage_type will be different, but user have chance to
 > define binding for them in 'bind section' of the template.
 > Finally, lable will be generated in 'transformer' in different
 > datasource, as long as lable is generated the same string, it's
 > unnecessary to define which field is label in template.
 > That is to say, we don't need to define "equals(get_attr(nova_instance,
 > 'id'), get_attr(k8s_instance, 'externalID'))", which is guarenteed
 > by datasource.
 > The key point is that, datasource must be responsible for creating
 > same label string among binding monitors.

I'll try to reply to both of your comments together :-)

Datasources should be independent. One datasource should not return key in a format of another datasource. If we do that, then it will soon become impossible to make changes in e.g. Zabbix, because each change might have unpredicted effect in e.g. Nagios. 

A resource or alarm vitrage_id is a UUID that is automatically generated. The datasource identifies the resource/alarm by a key, and there is a cache in TransformerBase (key_to_uuid_cache) that holds a key->uuid mapping. 

The missing piece of code is to know when to create a new vertex, and when to add properties to an existing vertex. We should have a new class/function that holds the equivalence/binding definition and makes the decision. I'm not sure yet who should call it and when, this is detailed design that can be done later. But I think that the wanted behavior is to keep the datasources code as is, and do the bindings elsewhere.'}, {'account_id': 24667, 'date': '2018-03-14 09:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> > I try to explain what xupeipei means.:)
 > > The identifier for a resource vertex include three items:
 > > ‘RESOURCE’, vitrage_type, and a lable.
 > > The lable is different in different datasources, for example,
 > lable
 > > is 'instance_id' or 'id' in nova.instance, and 'host_name' in
 > > nova.host.
 > > The point in the vitrage code is implemented in function:
 > > '_create_entity_key' in private method.
 > > Only when the three items are all the same, the entities will
 > > combine a same vertex.
 > > Firstly, ‘RESOURCE’ text is always same, so it's ok.
 > > Secondly, vitrage_type will be different, but user have chance to
 > > define binding for them in 'bind section' of the template.
 > > Finally, lable will be generated in 'transformer' in different
 > > datasource, as long as lable is generated the same string, it's
 > > unnecessary to define which field is label in template.
 > > That is to say, we don't need to define "equals(get_attr(nova_instance,
 > > 'id'), get_attr(k8s_instance, 'externalID'))", which is
 > guarenteed
 > > by datasource.
 > > The key point is that, datasource must be responsible for
 > creating
 > > same label string among binding monitors.
 > 
 > I'll try to reply to both of your comments together :-)
 > 
 > Datasources should be independent. One datasource should not return
 > key in a format of another datasource. If we do that, then it will
 > soon become impossible to make changes in e.g. Zabbix, because each
 > change might have unpredicted effect in e.g. Nagios.
 > 
 > A resource or alarm vitrage_id is a UUID that is automatically
 > generated. The datasource identifies the resource/alarm by a key,
 > and there is a cache in TransformerBase (key_to_uuid_cache) that
 > holds a key->uuid mapping.
 > 
 > The missing piece of code is to know when to create a new vertex,
 > and when to add properties to an existing vertex. We should have a
 > new class/function that holds the equivalence/binding definition
 > and makes the decision. I'm not sure yet who should call it and
 > when, this is detailed design that can be done later. But I think
 > that the wanted behavior is to keep the datasources code as is, and
 > do the bindings elsewhere.

Our goal is providing an uniform syntax to bind for both alarm and resource, so refering to your suggestion, I propose the syntax for binding resource as below
    - entity:
       category: RESOURCE
       template_id: id_vm
       rule: credibility
       bind:
        - item:
           type: nova.instance
           bind_key: 'id'
        - item:
           type: k8s.vm
           bind_key: 'externalID'
However, the question is that there are two places to describe the bind relation(nova.instance.id = k8s.vm.externalID),
one is text in template above, the other is in 'datasource:transformer' indirectly.
If we choose one of them, we should remove the other. That's why we advice 'no need to present bind(id, externalID) in template'.
Anyway, it's OK for us that choosing to describe the bind relation in template, and I think exposing bind_key to user is better than hardcode in datasource'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2018-03-17 05:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-03-18 08:25:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(3 comments)

> Our goal is providing an uniform syntax to bind for both alarm and
 > resource, so refering to your suggestion, I propose the syntax for
 > binding resource as below
 > - entity:
 > category: RESOURCE
 > template_id: id_vm
 > rule: credibility
 > bind:
 > - item:
 > type: nova.instance
 > bind_key: 'id'
 > - item:
 > type: k8s.vm
 > bind_key: 'externalID'
 > However, the question is that there are two places to describe the
 > bind relation(nova.instance.id = k8s.vm.externalID),
 > one is text in template above, the other is in 'datasource:transformer'
 > indirectly.
 > If we choose one of them, we should remove the other. That's why we
 > advice 'no need to present bind(id, externalID) in template'.
 > Anyway, it's OK for us that choosing to describe the bind relation
 > in template, and I think exposing bind_key to user is better than
 > hardcode in datasource

I think that the hard-coded bindings should not be defined in a template. A template is something that the user can edit at any time, and in case of k8s if the binding is removed then it breaks the entire datasource behavior. We can't let the user touch it. We should allow the user to modify the alarm binding, and maybe sometimes the resource binding (I don't have an example for that)."}]

[{'created': '2018-02-22 15:55:26.000000000', 'message': 'Limt jobs on release-tools presentations

commit_message:
Limt jobs on release-tools presentations

We are adding some onboarding presentations to this repo with
https://review.openstack.org/545066/. Since most jobs are not
interesting when things will change under this /presentations
directory, this limits jobs to just pep8.

Change-Id: I402e108d325952a0c2837e45a7238ba7ed11fd01

subject: repo-use.yml: Scope host groups properly
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-15 19:25:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-15 19:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-17 22:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-18 05:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 19:25:34.000000000', 'message': "repo-use.yml: Scope host groups properly

When using multi-region swift or when including more
thank just OpenStack-related hosts in the inventory,
it's important to scope where these tasks are run
properly to prevent attempts at doing things on the
wrong hosts.

The sope of the play now runs against the same scope
for hosts as the openstack-hosts playbook. This is
more consistent and will help prevent unwanted side-
effects.

Change-Id: Ia755845ac2b04f080db45905263059b92072d194
"}]
commit_message:
repo-use.yml: Scope host groups properly

When using multi-region swift or when including more
thank just OpenStack-related hosts in the inventory,
it's important to scope where these tasks are run
properly to prevent attempts at doing things on the
wrong hosts.

The sope of the play now runs against the same scope
for hosts as the openstack-hosts playbook. This is
more consistent and will help prevent unwanted side-
effects.

Change-Id: Ia755845ac2b04f080db45905263059b92072d194

commit_message:
Load Tacker Horizon's static files when deploy with devstack

Currently, when deploying tacker using devstack, the
static files of tacker-horizon are not loaded. This
patch fix that.

Change-Id: I63674788c1f1c68f8a624a7768945a1a2aa999c2
Closes-bug: #1752335

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: qos-specs

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below qos-specs API's
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/qos-specs/{qos_id}/delete_keys
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/qos-specs/{qos_id}
* POST /v3/{project_id}/qos-specs

Change-Id: I95756e549cc1b3bfbad16d029b7021527278b0d5
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

[{'created': '2018-03-09 05:48:58.000000000', 'message': 'restart_policy can not be None

security_groups is a dictionary variable, but the way to judge is
if container.restart_policy is not None
eg.
    (Pdb) container.restart_policy
    {}
    (Pdb) container.restart_policy is not None
    True

Change-Id: I84058fa6f7f3b2d51830e8b2eabcb9d4fc0dd42b
Closes-Bug: #1754545
'}]
commit_message:
restart_policy can not be None

security_groups is a dictionary variable, but the way to judge is
if container.restart_policy is not None
eg.
    (Pdb) container.restart_policy
    {}
    (Pdb) container.restart_policy is not None
    True

Change-Id: I84058fa6f7f3b2d51830e8b2eabcb9d4fc0dd42b
Closes-Bug: #1754545

commit_message:
The way to get neutron_port['security_groups'] is wrong

if no security_groups in neutron_port:
the error is:
(Pdb) neutron_port['security_groups']
*** KeyError: 'security_groups'

Change-Id: Iae68d7511890c81adda0d261ab0b70d4510971d1
Closes-Bug: #1754541

commit_message:
Failed to update memory for container

The bug happens in docker v1.13:
$docker update -m 10240000 0526a29a5b
Error response from daemon: Cannot update container
0526a29a5b547812ce8c1f66e875cd45e2dbc7a54fa24e636b5f93d1cc8e0768:
Memory limit should be smaller than already set memoryswap limit,
update the memoryswap at the same time

Change-Id: I3e5f1ae63ecbd93d4df8ad6a4de4ceb4817589da
Closes-Bug: #1718879

commit_message:
security_groups can not be None

security_groups is a list variable, but the way to judge is
‘if security_groups is None’

this should be modified
Closes-Bug: #1749400

Change-Id: Idedf53e86f5edf6c88b3942f8a343021a6b53710

commit_message:
Correct the response code of attach

The attach operation will return the URL that can be used to attach
to the container. The success response code is 200 instead of 202.

Change-Id: Ia467d6521e96df9e0338e129c85c13ad72124718

commit_message:
Fix missing print format error

Missing print format will cause 'ValueError: unsupported
format character' error, this is to fix it.

Change-Id: I6ee192a95d86209d041a4675935fc1643483571f

[{'created': '2018-03-16 02:23:44.000000000', 'message': "Use soft authorize for 'extended_snapshot_attributes' policy

Cinder use soft authorize to control whether display
snapshot's additional attributes, this is broken during
policy in code changes.

Change-Id: I4b1b3432275defafcfc60465d3079bc9d70c4f56
Closes-Bug: #1756002
"}]
commit_message:
Use soft authorize for 'extended_snapshot_attributes' policy

Cinder use soft authorize to control whether display
snapshot's additional attributes, this is broken during
policy in code changes.

Change-Id: I4b1b3432275defafcfc60465d3079bc9d70c4f56
Closes-Bug: #1756002

commit_message:
Merge haproxy plays

The two haproxy plays can be simplified into one, because they
are targetting the same hosts, in the same kind of way
(same serialization and environment)

Change-Id: Ibebec0a97345632f95d02ea74d018065919dca29

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 18:17:44.000000000', 'message': 'Update apt cache on proxy addition/removal

When the repo container is removed, the apt cache config
is still in place and causes problems.

This patch re-orders the tasks so that the removal can
be done and the cache is updated afterwards to confirm
a working state.

Change-Id: I0d1bf9617594d9a5c7c2ea3335c80cc2478df985
'}, {'created': '2018-03-15 18:56:36.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure package cache is updated appropriately

When the repo container is removed, the apt cache config
is still in place and causes problems. This is due to the
tasks running to remove the cache configuration not
executing early enough in the deployment.

This patch re-orders the tasks so that the removal can
be done and the cache is updated afterwards to confirm
a working state.

It also makes the configuration happen on all hosts, then
all containers, at the right timings to ensure that if the
container is removed, the proxy config will also be removed
automatically.

Change-Id: I0d1bf9617594d9a5c7c2ea3335c80cc2478df985
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure package cache is updated appropriately

When the repo container is removed, the apt cache config
is still in place and causes problems. This is due to the
tasks running to remove the cache configuration not
executing early enough in the deployment.

This patch re-orders the tasks so that the removal can
be done and the cache is updated afterwards to confirm
a working state.

It also makes the configuration happen on all hosts, then
all containers, at the right timings to ensure that if the
container is removed, the proxy config will also be removed
automatically.

Change-Id: I0d1bf9617594d9a5c7c2ea3335c80cc2478df985

commit_message:
Adding Glance method for listing image members and unit test

This is necessary for checking from Cinder's side whether the current
project has access to an image with 'shared' visibility.  Often a
clone_image request will arrive at a driver with Glance pointed at the
same backend and within Glance the image is set to 'shared' visibility.
Currently the driver will have to call Glance directly to determine if
it should continue cloning the image, or return a permissions error.

Change-Id: Idb9641e136bfc38bbfa881452053056e74bd0553

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-12 12:37:28.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Adds a Cache for Volumes Created from Snapshots with Quobyte

In order to speed up the creation of multiple volumes from a single
snapshot this change adds a cache of volumes created by merging a
snapshots backing chain. This behaviour can be activated via a new

commit_message:
Adds a Cache for Volumes Created from Snapshots with Quobyte

This is not related to the Cinder image cache.

In order to speed up the creation of multiple volumes from a single
snapshot this change adds a cache of volumes created by merging a
snapshots backing chain to the Quobyte driver.
This behaviour can be activated via a new config option
'quobyte_volume_from_snapshot_cache'.
Instead of merging a snapshots backing chain into a new volume each time
a volume is created from this snapshot, the new implementation merges the
backing chain into a volume in the new volume cache. New volumes to be
created from that snapshot are then copied from the cached volume and
no longer require the merging process.
Merging happens only for the first time when the cached volume copy is
created from a specific snapshot. Subsequent creations of volumes from
this snapshot are simply copied from the cache which requires no costly
backing chain merge.

Partial-Bug: #1715078

Change-Id: I2142b1c0a0cc2c4f85794416e702a326d3406b9d

[{'created': '2018-03-14 09:52:25.000000000', 'message': "V3 jsonschema validation: volume_image_metadata

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below volume image metadata
API's:
* Set image metadata for a volume
  POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action

* Remove image metadata from a volume
  POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action

Note: In this patch it will raise BadRequest(400) if user passes long
key and long value(greater than 255 characters) for metadata. Earlier
it was raising HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge(413) on master.

Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: I226391f60c0577d83c9beb94bfe1bc08ab22b708
"}]
commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: volume_image_metadata

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below volume image metadata
API's:
* Set image metadata for a volume
  POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action

* Remove image metadata from a volume
  POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action

Note: In this patch it will raise BadRequest(400) if user passes long
key and long value(greater than 255 characters) for metadata. Earlier
it was raising HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge(413) on master.

Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: I226391f60c0577d83c9beb94bfe1bc08ab22b708

commit_message:
Avoid build system IP going into sample config

We should not show the IP address of the build system as
the sample default for my_ip in /etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample .

This patch sets a sample_default that will be used instead.

Change-Id: If9ba07bb7f83c2ad3d89e2d5264c064117bbad23
closes-bug: 1755282

commit_message:
remove workaround for tuskar* packages

This change removes a workaround for remaining tuskar* packages after upgrade.
Original problem reported as: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1691744
We have that workaround in L, M, N and O releases.
It's time to get rid of it and forget about tuskar.

Closes-Bug: 1755537
Change-Id: I895dcd880281be3d07310f5983a4fa9fdb9fc88f

commit_message:
ScaleIO: Add documentation for containerized overcloud

When running a containerized overcloud, an additional
step is needed to map in the directories containing the
ScaleIO SDC components.

Change-Id: Iaa304ad80a84c3a649d53d519de0630c477a3429
(cherry picked from commit cc51bea02db758d466474bc36f221a3c768f22cf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 17:54:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix mysql connection

URL mysql://scott:***@some_host/some_db does not contain a '+drivername'
portion, and will make use of a default driver. A full dbname+drivername://
protocol is recommended. For MySQL, it is strongly recommended that
mysql+pymysql:// be specified for maximum service compatibility.

Change-Id: Ib5cbfcc412c04381f2fce9f319a313eb86ea7fa8
Closes-Bug: #1753342
(cherry picked from commit 76bce0ada4dbb0b59f4936ef4f9a6d76f82066f0)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix mysql connection

URL mysql://scott:***@some_host/some_db does not contain a '+drivername'
portion, and will make use of a default driver. A full dbname+drivername://
protocol is recommended. For MySQL, it is strongly recommended that
mysql+pymysql:// be specified for maximum service compatibility.

Change-Id: Ib5cbfcc412c04381f2fce9f319a313eb86ea7fa8
Closes-Bug: #1753342
(cherry picked from commit 76bce0ada4dbb0b59f4936ef4f9a6d76f82066f0)

commit_message:
Fix mysql connection

URL mysql://scott:***@some_host/some_db does not contain a '+drivername'
portion, and will make use of a default driver. A full dbname+drivername://
protocol is recommended. For MySQL, it is strongly recommended that
mysql+pymysql:// be specified for maximum service compatibility.

Change-Id: Ib5cbfcc412c04381f2fce9f319a313eb86ea7fa8
Closes-Bug: #1753342
(cherry picked from commit 76bce0ada4dbb0b59f4936ef4f9a6d76f82066f0)

subject: Generate redirects to official API reference URLs
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-10-22 18:01:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-10-22 18:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note that this is probably still going to result in some 404s.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-22 18:14:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Below is the generated content and it's wrong.

Example:
/api-ref/metering/(.*) /developer/ceilometer/webapi/index.html
There's no /developer/ on all of developer.openstack.org



# Redirect service-type name/alias-based URLs to official API reference locations
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/tricircle/(.*) /developer/tricircle/api_v1.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/volumev3/(.*) /api-ref/block-storage/$1
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/volumev2/(.*) /api-ref/block-storage/$1
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/rca/(.*) /developer/vitrage/vitrage-api.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/events/(.*) /developer/panko/webapi/index.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/application-container/(.*) /cgit/openstack/zun/tree/api-ref/source/$1
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/operator-policy/(.*) /developer/congress/api.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/policy/(.*) /developer/congress/api.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/multi-region-network-automation/(.*) /developer/tricircle/api_v1.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/container/(.*) /cgit/openstack/zun/tree/api-ref/source/$1
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/application_deployment/(.*) /developer/solum/develop_applications/webapi/index.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/meter/(.*) /developer/ceilometer/webapi/index.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/rating/(.*) /developer/cloudkitty/webapi/root.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/sharev2/(.*) /api-ref/shared-file-system/$1
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/application-deployment/(.*) /developer/solum/develop_applications/webapi/index.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/container-infrastructure/(.*) /api-ref/container-infrastructure-management/$1
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/baremetal-introspection/(.*) /developer/ironic-inspector/http-api.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/root-cause-analysis/(.*) /developer/vitrage/vitrage-api.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/workflowv2/(.*) /developer/mistral/developer/webapi/index.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/share/(.*) /api-ref/shared-file-system/$1
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/resource-cluster/(.*) /api-ref/clustering/$1
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/workflow/(.*) /developer/mistral/developer/webapi/index.html
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/monitoring-log-api/(.*) /api-ref/monitoring-logging/$1
redirectmatch 301 /api-ref/messaging/(.*) /api-ref/message/$1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-22 18:01:33.000000000', 'message': "Generate redirects to official API reference URLs

Use the service-types-authority data (via os-service-types) to glean the
official api_reference URLs for each service type.  Generate a redirect
from any URL of the form /api-ref/{name-or-alias} to its official
api_reference (if it's not already that).

For official API reference URLs ending in an HTML file, redirect any
source to that index.

Otherwise, map subpaths (e.g. /api-ref/alias/path/to/file.html =>
/api-ref/official/path/to/file.html)

Change-Id: I6baa34e4db4b0fb85c7a75f4171d3e40c8cd920a
"}]
commit_message:
Generate redirects to official API reference URLs

Use the service-types-authority data (via os-service-types) to glean the
official api_reference URLs for each service type.  Generate a redirect
from any URL of the form /api-ref/{name-or-alias} to its official
api_reference (if it's not already that).

For official API reference URLs ending in an HTML file, redirect any
source to that index.

Otherwise, map subpaths (e.g. /api-ref/alias/path/to/file.html =>
/api-ref/official/path/to/file.html)

Change-Id: I6baa34e4db4b0fb85c7a75f4171d3e40c8cd920a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-17 14:23:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'properties' is undefined errors

When following the example playbook for the role, it is possible for
properties undefined to be raise. Because default() filters don't work
with undefined dictionary keys, ensure a default dictionary for
properties exists.

Change-Id: Iee2e992efe8ee801506e5de622bd90ac3915a33c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f2b3780c8dec8e38ba11879b83f4f34afa792629)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'properties' is undefined errors

When following the example playbook for the role, it is possible for
properties undefined to be raise. Because default() filters don't work
with undefined dictionary keys, ensure a default dictionary for
properties exists.

Change-Id: Iee2e992efe8ee801506e5de622bd90ac3915a33c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f2b3780c8dec8e38ba11879b83f4f34afa792629)

[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:21:23.000000000', 'message': 'gerrit tests should return to checked out branch

when running "tox -e gerrit" on a local checkout
after the tests have finshed the repo is checked out
to the HEAD commit, not the branch that was checked
out before the run.

This ensures the branch is checked out at the end
of the test.

Change-Id: I58dae937000d05c3a9b09dc4aed5362a5c56d133
'}]
commit_message:
gerrit tests should return to checked out branch

when running "tox -e gerrit" on a local checkout
after the tests have finshed the repo is checked out
to the HEAD commit, not the branch that was checked
out before the run.

This ensures the branch is checked out at the end
of the test.

Change-Id: I58dae937000d05c3a9b09dc4aed5362a5c56d133

commit_message:
Migration to Storyboard

Sahara projects migrated to storyboard.openstack.org.
Replace the references to Launchpad, including the rename of
a documentation page focuse on launchpad (which would
probably require a redirect on the openstack.org site),
and clean up some old details about blueprints.
Fix the bug links in the openstackdocstheme configuration.

Change-Id: I30642356f1b1076a874f14fc43fad234fa9a098d

I noticed there's 15 minutes being spent on the 'LXC container restart' task between setup-infra and setup-openstack in the patch to unblock the integrated master branch. The job keeps timing out.

http://logs.openstack.org/42/550542/12/check/openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_lxc-ubuntu-xenial/5416ffe/logs/ara/"}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-03-10 02:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I came across the same thing and have gone about it in config https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553949/ happy to go with either option.'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-03-17 15:45:42.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Thanks. Your's seems cleaner and avoids having to touch each stop task."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-10 01:17:20.000000000', 'message': 'Stop containers without waiting

The handler for stopping LXC containers attempts a clean stop but seems
to consistently time out and perform a hard stop after 60 seconds. We
can save time during the gate tests and for deployers by attempting an
upfront kill without waiting.

Change-Id: I04ee1e248ccd38f6a164dba97cc170c6fb98f9e0
'}]
commit_message:
Stop containers without waiting

The handler for stopping LXC containers attempts a clean stop but seems
to consistently time out and perform a hard stop after 60 seconds. We
can save time during the gate tests and for deployers by attempting an
upfront kill without waiting.

Change-Id: I04ee1e248ccd38f6a164dba97cc170c6fb98f9e0

commit_message:
Re-enable the erasurecode storage policy for RHEL

We disabled the erasurecode storage policy for CentOS builds, because
the version of liberasurecode caused issues in some gate jobs.

The release of pike now means that liberasurecode 1.5.0 is setup by
default, which resolves this issue. We should re-enable the
erasure code storage policy.

Change-Id: I96a2609bad7d1bcc9faf85d3561d00c8e047c18a

Fix the bug link in the openstackdocstheme configuration.

commit_message:
Migration to Storyboard

Sahara projects migrated to storyboard.openstack.org.
Replace the references to Launchpad, including the usage of
blueprints (apart from historical references).
Fix the bug link in the openstackdocstheme configuration.

Change-Id: Ib7060f888bc2a28690c4f9498f2925909ad75bc2

commit_message:
undercloud: enable only metadata cleaning

We plan on disabling automated cleaning by default, but when it's
enabled, we only need the metadata cleaning, because the full secure
cleaning takes hours when secure ATA erase is not supported.

Partial-Bug: #1754609
Change-Id: Icd8b86a7ab3cff21efb113cb58bd6690cd29a03c

folks, I'm very impressed with secret Heat magic! How come this http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/puppet/services/ironic-conductor.yaml#n172 and n173 works (is it?..), but https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550100/1/environments/undercloud.yaml@45 mutates 'ctlplane' into an IP address?? And would it as well translate 'ctlplane' into IP for the revision 2 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550100/2/environments/undercloud.yaml@58 ? Could someone explain me how this works please?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-03-07 13:26:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> folks, I'm very impressed with secret Heat magic!

++ I never stop enjoying it :D I guess Steve can enlighten you."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-07 13:57:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It's not secret, TripleO has done this for years to enable setting per-network bind IPs in config_settings.

IronicCleaningNetwork works currently because it's set to a placeholder called "provisioning", which isn't a network managed by TripleO, e.g it's not in the NetIpMap we maintain internally.

Then on update, you pass a UUID (or create a network called "provisioning" outside of TripleO I guess), so there is no conflict with the networks managed by tripleo.

This is how it works, it's very simple (a single map_replace in puppet/role.role.j2.yaml), but as this patch shows, occasionally inconvenient - I already have a patch up which removes this behavior and moves to hiera interpolation:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526692/

So we can rebase that and potentially remove this issue in future.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-07 14:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thank you for the explanation Steven!'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-07 14:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-07 17:30:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm still failing to make it included into my local OVB setup with ZUUL_CHANGES. And the original OVB job fails w/o any details https://review.rdoproject.org/jenkins/job/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001-master/7247/consoleFull . So I'm blocked to test this..."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-03-07 23:08:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-08 11:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

It worked for my local OVB test env:

sudo hiera ironic::conductor::provisioning_network

shows ctlplane'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-03-08 12:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-03-08 12:35:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-08 14:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-03-08 20:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-09 09:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-03-09 19:04:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

[{'created': '2018-03-06 14:49:17.000000000', 'message': "undercloud: set cleaning and provisioning networks to 'ctlplane'

In the overcloud we default to a network called 'provisioning' that
has to be created manually post-install. In the undercloud the ctlplane
network servers the same role. This change fixes cleaning in
the containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: I60dff35a8565b4d3cfbfb9c6b9694cb72976ebbf
Closes-Bug: #1753771

commit_message:
undercloud: set cleaning and provisioning networks to 'ctlplane'

In the overcloud we default to a network called 'provisioning' that
has to be created manually post-install. In the undercloud the ctlplane
network servers the same role. This change fixes cleaning in
the containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: I60dff35a8565b4d3cfbfb9c6b9694cb72976ebbf
Closes-Bug: #1753771

commit_message:
Adding support for RHEL images

Adding support for rhel images on the image generation system.

Note.: It is necessary to previous to start packing the image for the
user to register the image using virt-costumize and also enable the
necessary REPOS.

Change-Id: Ia8c483d34a26ba0ccfe25b5496cc03af4c1b7808
(cherry picked from commit 33335b449b49dd9a61436449862cd7d094e2199d)

commit_message:
Bump OpenStack service version

* Bump ec2-api from stable-queens to 6.0.0
* Bump karbor from stable-queens to 1.0.0
* Bump nova from 17.0.0 to 17.0.1
* Bump novajoin from master to 1.0.18
* Bump networking-l2gw from stable-queens to 12.0.1
* Bump senlin from 5.0.0 to 5.0.1
* Bump solum-dashboard from stable-queens to 2.3.0
* Bump tripleo-ui from 8.2.0 to 8.3.0
* Bump vmtp from master to 2.4.5
* Bump vmware-nsx from stable-queens to 12.0.1
* Bump vmware-nsxlib from stable-queens to 12.0.1

Change-Id: I70bddf5668582ed5b519a4e9306503ec7722d043

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-03 00:08:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove race and simplify conntrack state management

This change:
* removes a q.emtpy() vs. q.get() race
* avoids creating lost of short-lived threads
  (because: why would we ?)
* avoids calling spawn_n in a while True
  (what is inside spawn_n might fail, and if
  the failure happens all the time, then we
  have a possible scenario to explain bug 1750777)
* add a try/except block to be sure we can log
  any issue that would otherwise be hidden by
  spawn_n

I'd be ready to bet a Guinness that it solves bug
1750777, but unless we can reproduce it it is hard to tell.
How come we don't have a Hopefully-Solves-Bug: tag ?

Change-Id: Ic348c08af375099a919116188ae17d2017695ecb
Related-Bug: 1750777

commit_message:
Remove race and simplify conntrack state management

This change:
* avoids creating lots of short-lived threads
  (because: why would we ?)
* adds a try/except block to be sure we can log
  any issue that would otherwise be hidden by
  spawn_n.
* changes class from Queue to LightQueue after
  eventlet.queue code inspection, since it's a
  little smaller and should be faster

Change-Id: Ic348c08af375099a919116188ae17d2017695ecb
Closes-Bug: 1750777

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ui container

This adds the tripleo-ui image to the containers list, and should make
it available on the dockerhub with the next RDO promotion.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515490/
Partially-Implements: bp tripleo-ui-undercloud-container
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I279faf3f5ec42b25cc2d374ccd9108366b7a2733

subject: docker: add support for TripleO UI

commit_message:
Add neutron/horizon to blacklist

Having neutron/horizon in constraints breaks all tools/tox_install.sh.

While we work on fixing them, remove the constraints.

We can revert this change later.

Change-Id: I7b8f2be1061dafa3d90674e3160650a3e967c219

commit_message:
Add ISCSI driver for Veritas Access

This driver implements all the minimum required features for cinder.

Change-Id: I48b59a2ecab8b856547a4ae17e6e0fd04094475a
Implement: blueprint veritas-access-cinder-iscsi-support

[{'created': '2018-02-20 18:44:51.000000000', 'message': 'Tests: Fix backup validation with hash randomization

The exact error generated here can vary depending on
Python version, jsonschema version, and hash randomization.

Ensure that a useful message and HTTP 400 is still
generated.

Change-Id: Ibc6c20e6ffce58c6bbef3155f73e54909d76e132
'}]
commit_message:
Tests: Fix backup validation with hash randomization

The exact error generated here can vary depending on
Python version, jsonschema version, and hash randomization.

Ensure that a useful message and HTTP 400 is still
generated.

Change-Id: Ibc6c20e6ffce58c6bbef3155f73e54909d76e132

These tests rely on comparing strings that are generated
from dicts, which may be randomly ordered.

commit_message:
Use oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures

The change in Iaf77db73e368aee0d09b4c8e76f180f394f1aa37
makes use of oslo_db.tests.*, which was not the intent of the
deprecations added to oslo_db in
I0163e637ffef6d45d2573ebe29b5438911d01fce.   Make use of the
newer fixtures in oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures which is
what was intended to supersede oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_base.

Change-Id: I49a5e61345ce7c90a527367ae69a28ac04295865
(cherry picked from commit 2bc0f147058d6e0d3ca523f42a70c747b587ebaf)

[{'created': '2018-02-16 20:45:04.000000000', 'message': 'docs: Fix volume encryption link

Currently, the volume encryption documentation has a link that
points to itself, instead of pointing to the Horizon docs.
This patch updates the link to point to the Horizon docs.

Change-Id: Ic5e1e3e865ee83f23e651b34bf2ef236ac3b269c
'}]
commit_message:
docs: Fix volume encryption link

Currently, the volume encryption documentation has a link that
points to itself, instead of pointing to the Horizon docs.
This patch updates the link to point to the Horizon docs.

Change-Id: Ic5e1e3e865ee83f23e651b34bf2ef236ac3b269c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 16:32:57.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a hint when performing a volume action can't find the method

There is no CLI for the os-force_detach volume action API, and while
making a request for it with curl, I mistakenly used the Accept
header rather than the Content-Type header and got the unhelpful
error message:

  "There is no such action: None"

We can provide some simple details in the error message about
making sure the request body is correct and that the Content-Type
header is specified to help the user.

Change-Id: I00600c297e39c0dd097f9da80b1dccb38ee3d235
Closes-Bug: #1749983
'}]
commit_message:
Provide a hint when performing a volume action can't find the method

There is no CLI for the os-force_detach volume action API, and while
making a request for it with curl, I mistakenly used the Accept
header rather than the Content-Type header and got the unhelpful
error message:

  "There is no such action: None"

We can provide some simple details in the error message about
making sure the request body is correct and that the Content-Type
header is specified to help the user.

Change-Id: I00600c297e39c0dd097f9da80b1dccb38ee3d235
Closes-Bug: #1749983

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Copy offload bugfix

When 'NetApp NFS Copy Offload' tool is configured to download Glance
images, these images are downloaded twice because the tool is doing
the job after Cinder has already done it.
This patch fixes the bug by executing the copy offload tool inside the
clone_image function instead of using the copy_image_to_volume.

Closes-bug: #1632333
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/542770

Change-Id: I5c6ad150543213acfd0c78dbbdb1dc1584d22d26
(cherry-picked from commit c27173bad69da4889a5237cf2becc14bb6fc578a)

commit_message:
Admin guide documentation for volume multiattach

After giving some love to the multi-attach section it hopefully captures
the main characteristics of the functionality that we usually include
in the Admin Guide, such as volume creation, policies, microversions,
and back end support.

Depends-On: I11f97cf79e0c947b42de69cf8a7f6c1dbdb943a1

Co-Authored-By: Ildiko Vancsa <ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I77bb849e039e1b44964ac0f30d48b5c16ca41b44
(cherry picked from commit cb361631eda6df5a989b6543fb27533bd9f5fdfe)

The octavia project is using x509 functions that are available starting
with version 2.1 of cryptography.  Upper-constraints is already at 2.1.4 for

commit_message:
Update G-R for cryptography>=2.1

The octavia project is using x509 functions that are available starting
with version 2.1 of cryptography.  Upper-constraints is already at 2.1.4 for
this package.

Change-Id: I78f363810cf25a36da17a0524d0651c3174d5611

high: better availability.

commit_message:
FFU: Introduce post FFU steps and use them for qeens switch

In last step of FFU we need to swich repos before running upgrade.
We do so by introducing post FFU steps and running the switch in
them. We also update heat agents and os-collect-config on nodes.

Change-Id: I649afc6fa384ae21edc5bc917f8bb586350e5d47
(cherry picked from commit 26c55d15cd476f9705c3ce303dc7c08e7448c32c)

commit_message:
Optimize kernel neighbour table for large scale environments

Changing the default values of neighbor table (also known as ARP table)
in the kernel to avoid neighbour table overflow and thus fix
communication errors between overcloud nodes.
default kernel values support L2 network up to 1024 hosts (/22).
The patch will allow up to 4096 hosts (/20).

Conflicts:
	puppet/services/kernel.yaml

Change-Id: I5fabc766dd75a38cd3d835deee7e168f04dd30ce
Closes-Bug: #1690087
(cherry picked from commit 1651a1805a16212299fe0a91aebb2a91ed39bc6e)

commit_message:
Optimize kernel neighbour table for large scale environments

Changing the default values of neighbor table (also known as ARP table)
in the kernel to avoid neighbour table overflow and thus fix
communication errors between overcloud nodes.
default kernel values support L2 network up to 1024 hosts (/22).
The patch will allow up to 4096 hosts (/20).

Conflicts:
	puppet/services/kernel.yaml

Change-Id: I5fabc766dd75a38cd3d835deee7e168f04dd30ce
Closes-Bug: #1690087
(cherry picked from commit 1651a1805a16212299fe0a91aebb2a91ed39bc6e)

[{'created': '2018-03-07 05:27:40.000000000', 'message': "Increase size of Heat HeatMaxJsonBodySize

Most of the HTTP servers default max body size to 1MB, Apache, Nginx.
That default value is ok as long as users mostly get data from server
but when something needs to be uploaded, 1MB limit is often not enough.
This is what we see with Heat and some of the large templates.
It's not uncommon that WSGI apps have 10MB+ body size limit,
so with the current Heat default value we are still in low range sizes.

Original Heat template HeatMaxJsonBodySize default value was 1M and now
it will be 4M. There is aslo corresponding change in instack-undercloud
where we bumped 'max_template_size' to the same value.

Change-Id: I974f6d4adbc08f2960a164b90ebb784ca466e76a
Closes-Bug: 1752467
(cherry picked from commit c310cd131f261c5f1f5dc27437993b2954f18cdd)
"}]
commit_message:
Increase size of Heat HeatMaxJsonBodySize

Most of the HTTP servers default max body size to 1MB, Apache, Nginx.
That default value is ok as long as users mostly get data from server
but when something needs to be uploaded, 1MB limit is often not enough.
This is what we see with Heat and some of the large templates.
It's not uncommon that WSGI apps have 10MB+ body size limit,
so with the current Heat default value we are still in low range sizes.

Original Heat template HeatMaxJsonBodySize default value was 1M and now
it will be 4M. There is aslo corresponding change in instack-undercloud
where we bumped 'max_template_size' to the same value.

Change-Id: I974f6d4adbc08f2960a164b90ebb784ca466e76a
Closes-Bug: 1752467
(cherry picked from commit c310cd131f261c5f1f5dc27437993b2954f18cdd)

subject: neutron: Call destroy-patch-ports before starting ovs-agent
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 21798, 'name': 'Bernard Cafarelli', 'email': 'bcafarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcafarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-03-15 08:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-03-15 17:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-03-16 22:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 08:16:42.000000000', 'message': "neutron: Call destroy-patch-ports before starting ovs-agent

The script called destroy-patch-ports will break connection between the
integration bridge and provider bridges configured in Neutron config
files. See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1490281 for more
details about the reason.

With systemd, we have control over dependencies between services,
therefore we can tell that destroy-patch-ports service must be run
before neutron-openvswitch-agent. But we do not have this ability using
docker. That's why this patch simply calls the script before each start
of the agent. To avoid unnecessary breakage of patch ports, the script
was enhanced to check a canary flow on integration bridge and in case
the flow is there, it will not delete the patch ports. Presence of
canary flow on integration bridge means that bridge has been already
configured. It also implies provider bridges are configured too and thus
they can't cause the ARP storm as described in Red Hat Bugzilla 1490281.

NOTE: This patch requires the packaging side to be merged first:
      https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/10480/

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Closes-bug: #1731924

Change-Id: I005af23b1815c904ef63676553df9b14b7edfbfc
(cherry picked from commit e860b9580c708ef8fb810f95563ec1f956952bb1)
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: Call destroy-patch-ports before starting ovs-agent

The script called destroy-patch-ports will break connection between the
integration bridge and provider bridges configured in Neutron config
files. See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1490281 for more
details about the reason.

With systemd, we have control over dependencies between services,
therefore we can tell that destroy-patch-ports service must be run
before neutron-openvswitch-agent. But we do not have this ability using
docker. That's why this patch simply calls the script before each start
of the agent. To avoid unnecessary breakage of patch ports, the script
was enhanced to check a canary flow on integration bridge and in case
the flow is there, it will not delete the patch ports. Presence of
canary flow on integration bridge means that bridge has been already
configured. It also implies provider bridges are configured too and thus
they can't cause the ARP storm as described in Red Hat Bugzilla 1490281.

NOTE: This patch requires the packaging side to be merged first:
      https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/10480/

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Closes-bug: #1731924

Change-Id: I005af23b1815c904ef63676553df9b14b7edfbfc
(cherry picked from commit e860b9580c708ef8fb810f95563ec1f956952bb1)

We can't interpolate hiera parameters when setting values
for the ceph-ansible parameters.

[{'created': '2017-05-31 14:13:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add novajoin docker service

Change-Id: I3aad8a90816e6fc443f20579f6ac7ad4f35eafcb
'}, {'created': '2017-06-02 07:06:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add novajoin puppet/docker service

This adds the relevant templates to enable novajoin in a containerized
undercloud environment. Note that this is not meant for the overcloud
(yet), and since there are several limitations that need to be addressed
first. So, given this, we set up novajoin to be accessed directly and
not via a load balancer.

Depends-On: Iea461f66b8f4e3b01a0498e566a2c3684144df80
Change-Id: I3aad8a90816e6fc443f20579f6ac7ad4f35eafcb

commit_message:
Add novajoin service

This adds the relevant templates to enable novajoin in a containerized
undercloud environment. Note that this is not meant for the overcloud
(yet), and since there are several limitations that need to be addressed
first. This is meant for the containerized undercloud.

Depends-On: Iea461f66b8f4e3b01a0498e566a2c3684144df80
Depends-On: Ia733b436d5ebd0710253c070ec47a655036e0751
Depends-On: I554125fd6b48e620370f9e3a6061bbdc1d55b0ae
Change-Id: I3aad8a90816e6fc443f20579f6ac7ad4f35eafcb

commit_message:
Dropped legacy Ceph cookbook

- The Ceph cookbook fork[0] that is currently used has not been updated since
  2015, and is not maintained for Chef 13. This is dropped in favor of a
  blueprint to reimplement Ceph functionality with a more alive fork.

[0]: https://github.com/ceph/ceph-cookbook

Implements blueprint reimplement-ceph

Change-Id: I908620e98849aeae4a6f86ee3a350c6e13578805

subject: Catch an error when pool creation failed for ceph
messages: [{'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-03-13 03:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-03-13 07:16:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-03-16 12:56:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11869, 'date': '2018-03-17 05:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-13 03:14:40.000000000', 'message': 'Catch an error when pool creation failed for ceph

Ceph mon have a configure about "mon_max_pg_per_osd"
and default value is 300.
When pgs per osd is exceeded, pool creation will be failed.
But kolla-ansible ignoring this, so user may difficult to find
a main reason for the failure.
We need to catch an error when pool creation is failed.

Change-Id: I92493584faad9bc550fdeeb96b827537daafd0b8
Closes-Bug: #1747414
(cherry picked from commit 59d33d39887ed1efe5b8833473abcdd2735b0e98)
'}]
commit_message:
Catch an error when pool creation failed for ceph

Ceph mon have a configure about "mon_max_pg_per_osd"
and default value is 300.
When pgs per osd is exceeded, pool creation will be failed.
But kolla-ansible ignoring this, so user may difficult to find
a main reason for the failure.
We need to catch an error when pool creation is failed.

Change-Id: I92493584faad9bc550fdeeb96b827537daafd0b8
Closes-Bug: #1747414
(cherry picked from commit 59d33d39887ed1efe5b8833473abcdd2735b0e98)

When running the doc building a new scenario was generated,

generate that page from scratch, and ensure it's always the

Change-Id: I9098f5d76b73be5ef28684027ff5039cd52d6ddb

commit_message:
[Docs] Fix doc building idempotency

When running the doc building a new scenario was generated,
and appened to the scenario-table-gen.html page. We should instead
generate that page from scratch, and ensure it's always the
same content. This doesn't clean the scenario table gen, it simply
makes sure the generated content is always ordered the same way.

Change-Id: I9098f5d76b73be5ef28684027ff5039cd52d6ddb

commit_message:
Increase DIB disk space to 3GB

Currently, most distribution require now 3GB images.
Octavia team is working on shrining that in the future
but for now this is the recommended setting for DIB.

Change-Id: I23f72f7f8f3000159d8dfd8b6030d67d524aada1

for the existance of pre_install for now.  Every install method

Change-Id: Ia8aadbae6da955912256ebdb97af0fd7a0673a9c

commit_message:
Drop pre_install and merge it into install

As we are adding binary deployments, it is no longer necessary
for the existance of pre_install for now.  Every install method
will have it's own pre_install inside it's install type tasks
file.

Change-Id: Ia8aadbae6da955912256ebdb97af0fd7a0673a9c

commit_message:
Modify huawei switch configuration

1.Huawei switch does'n not solve the action of deleting port.
So it will lead to safety issues.
2. Add some configuration for Huawei PLUG_PORT_TO_NETWORK to ensure
interface access vlan.

Change-Id: Iba42ea92b831c55746165dd4fdf8c585b81a9901
Closes-Bug: #1753421
(cherry picked from commit a4f953109564f9dda05d292b391397b1cf98daa1)

[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-16 13:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-16 13:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

The intent of the original patch is probably good, but I think for now we should revert it and reevaluate the best way to accomplish what it was trying to do.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-03-16 14:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If we really need to revert this patch it means that the tests that are failing are not properly done, because doing a full collection of the backend stats on each delete operation is WRONG, pure and simple.

In my opinion what needs to be fixed are the tests.'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2018-03-16 14:46:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Build failed.  To recheck use 'run-INFINIDAT'.  For 3rd party ci contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- dsvm-tempest-infinibox-fc http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/94/553794/1/check/dsvm-tempest-infinibox-fc/c554735 : SUCCESS in 57m 28s
- dsvm-tempest-infinibox-iscsi http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/94/553794/1/check/dsvm-tempest-infinibox-iscsi/0c0a423 : FAILURE in 15m 48s"}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-03-16 15:11:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Looking at the actual error in the logs makes me think that we need to increase the max_over_subscription_ratio configured in the gate, create a bigger backend, or reduce the speed at which we create volumes.

That or we stop deducting the full volume size in the scheduler from free_capacity_gb in the Cinder scheduler for thin provisioned volumes.

On a side note, there seems to be some other issues in the Cinder Scheduler:

- We can get to negative numbers for free_capacity_gb

- We are logging some incoherent things:

Looking at req-8cd996a1-3662-44ab-9ca2-593aa84833b3 in one of the failures [1] we would assume that the backend has more than enough space for the volume from the logged information at Mar 16 13:26:41.201266:

{'provisioned_capacity_gb': 1.0, 
 'volume_backend_name': 'lvmdriver-1', 
 'location_info': 'LVMVolumeDriver:ubuntu-xenial-rax-ord-0003018294:stack-volumes-lvmdriver-1:thin:0',
 'free_capacity_gb': 22.76, 
 'allocated_capacity_gb': 7,
 'total_volumes': 2,
 'pool_name': 'lvmdriver-1',
 'reserved_percentage': 0, 
 'max_over_subscription_ratio': '20.0',
 'total_capacity_gb': 22.8}

But that's not the actual data that is used for filtering as can be seen in the log entry of that same request at Mar 16 13:26:41.202743:

Backend: host 'ubuntu-xenial-rax-ord-0003018294@lvmdriver-1#lvmdriver-1'
free_capacity_gb: -0.23999999999999844, 
total_capacity_gb: 22.8
allocated_capacity_gb: 30
max_over_subscription_ratio: 20.0
reserved_percentage: 0
provisioned_capacity_gb: 24.0


[1] http://logs.openstack.org/67/550967/4/check/tempest-full-py3/c67e31b/controller/logs/screen-c-sch.txt"}, {'account_id': 24502, 'date': '2018-03-16 15:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- dsvm-veritas-hyperscale-cinder-driver http://52.35.51.88/94/553794/1/check/dsvm-veritas-hyperscale-cinder-driver/3631cfb : SUCCESS in 1h 26m 51s'}, {'account_id': 24863, 'date': '2018-03-16 15:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed. For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- dsvm-veritas-access-cinder-driver http://52.42.67.99/94/553794/1/check/dsvm-veritas-access-cinder-driver/13f2ce9 : SUCCESS in 1h 14m 01s
- dsvm-veritas-access-cinder-iscsi-driver http://52.42.67.99/94/553794/1/check/dsvm-veritas-access-cinder-iscsi-driver/4fa7183 : FAILURE in 1h 23m 01s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-16 15:36:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Gorka, we've got a pretty high failure rate across the integrated gate from this, so can we not stall fixing the gate while a more elegant solution is worked on? It's nothing to do with the tests, there have been no test changes since the spike in failures."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-03-16 15:42:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

We need to fix the default values for the gates, since the tests are relying on Cinder doing something that it shouldn't be doing, but it makes sense to merge this revert to unfreeze the gates, then fix the values on the gates, and then merge the patch again."}, {'account_id': 24815, 'date': '2018-03-16 19:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:
